text: Bottle from Ale Arsenal. Hazy, copper pour with bubbly ring of beige head. Caramel on the aroma, bready malts. Taste amplifies the caramel, mildly sweet, strong too. Fruitcake, raisins and molasses. Dries out a bit in the finish. Ill be feeling this tomorrow.

Deep copper colored, medium sized beige head. Aromas of malt, dates, syrup, raisins, dried figs, caramel, hops and alcohol. Taste of caramel, candy sugar, malt, resin, bitter hops, dried fruits and peaches with a medium bitter finish. Solid American style Barley wine.

Nie wiem skąd ale wziął się tu intensywny jałowiec. Poza tym w aromacie orzechy włoskie. W smaku mocno ziołowo i leśnie oraz na przeciwnym biegunie rodzynkowo i waniliowo. Wybitnie degustacyjne, trzeba mu poświęcić solidną porcję czasu żeby się nim najlepiej nacieszyć.

Röd, klar.
Doft: Torkad frukt, malt, bränt socker, syrlig, lite spritig, lite humle.
Smak: nötig, torkad frukt, apelsin, lite humlebeska, lite vitt vin, torr.
bomber pours clear amber with white head aroma is caramel malts and dark fruit taste is caramel vanilla and ripe freuit slightly boozey on finish

Butelkowane 2014. Totalnie w stylu AleSmith - niezwykle słodowe - toffi, karmel, rodzynki i inne suszone owoce,lekkie kakao. Niestety po tych kilku latach została jedynie goryczka chmielowa. Piwo raczej umiarkowanie słodkie, utlenienie chmielu lekko podbija słodycz piwa. Rzekłbym, że raczej klasyczne BW, nie wiem jak się prezentuje świeżo zabutelkowane. Na pewno bardzo dobrz eułożone, wysoce pijalne, alkohol dobrze ukryty. Dla lubiący styl AleSmith piwo obowiązkowe.

Flaska från Beergium. Osäker på årtal, kan vara ganska färsk. Provning med ölsällskapet. Klar kopparröd med halvfinger högt, gräddig, beige skumkrona. Doftar torkad frukt, mandelmassa, knäck och malt. Stor, oljig, lite matt kropp. Stor i smaken med rejäla nötiga och knäckiga toner och lite inslag av apelsinskal. Stor och potent med värmande alkohol. Väl sammansatt. Håller ihop väl mellan sötma, storlek och alkohol. Ganska straightforward och klassisk barley wine. Gott!

Lovely. Hopped and dryhopped - dont know, but its malt richness, deepness is so cosmically well balanced, rounded up with bitterness and hops flavor. Man... one of those beers you regret when its empty bottle. I wonder what is the big difference between this BW and some similar light/dark-to-darker malts combo Wee Heavy?

Piwo bursztynowe z jasno-beżową pianą. W aromacie przede wszystkim suszone owoce, karmel. Czuć też słodkie, dojrzałe owoce. Zapach jest świetny, intensywny. W smaku suszone owoce, karmel, słodkie tropikalne owoce, jest też lekka wanilia, na finiszu subtelna goryczka. Piwo ma bardzo gładką fakturę, niskie wysycenie pije się przyjemnie. Myślałem, że piłem już dobre barley wine, ale old numbskull to zweryfikował. To piwo jest wspaniałe.

Pite w ramach panelu w Carpe Kraft. Na samym początku zachwyca już wygląd. Piana drobnopęcherzykowa oblepia szkło i utrzymuje się do końca picia. Kolor opalizujący, ciemno miedziany. Aromat karmelizowanych owoców daktyle, figi, rodzynki, szlachetny alkohol. Smak jest trochę zaskoczeniem na plus, czuć wyraźnie gorycz ale nie męczącą, jest także słodko wyklejające. Bardzo dobre.
Pours amber, clear, minimal head. Fruits, alcohol, hops, raisins, more alcohol, malts, caramel. Sweet, but than massive bitterness. Full body, extremely oily.

750ml brown bottle. Colour is deep golden/amber, the beige head is thick and full, very sticky and clingy in the glass. Nose has toffee malt sweetness, brown sugar, rich malts, orange. Taste - toffee malts, dark sugar, sponge candy, late hop notes. Late bitterness, lasting malt richness and hop bitterness. The body is full, good carbonation for a heavy beer. Alcohol is well integrated. Hell of a nice beer.

Super sweet aroma with a bit of hops. Flavors provide a combo of fruits, caramel, & citrus hops with a big boozy finish. Ive also had this at a year old, and I think thats where its really at its best; hops recede to allow more of the roasted malts to come thru. Boozy fresh and even boozier as it ages. Exemplary American barleywine.

Sweet aroma of ripe exotic fruits with some resin notes on the decent caramel background. Full bodied but not very sweet, slightly warming, soft carbonation with silky finish. Hops and malts symphony!

Brown and slight orange tinge with a very dense thin tan head. Smell is incredible, lots of resinous hop oiils and dark fruitiness, cigar, a deep caramel roast malt. Flavour is huge, tons of caramel malt sweetness, packed with hop oiliness, end of having a slight bitter aftertaste. Hops are very earthy and rich, very full bodied and warming. Incredibly decadent, wonderful beer!

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 Home. Hazy dark amber with white head. Big sweet roasted barley and light caramel. Dry and bitter medicinal and bandaids, rubberbands. Somewhere hoppy. Medium sweet, quite bitter for the style. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Its like Wolfenstein 2D. Update the next day: my skull is numb af.

Bottle shared thanks to Mrk. Clear dark amber with quite big beige head. Caramel, strong grass and lime peel, burning alcohol, toffee, raisins, some red wine, light wood and bitter herbs. Medium sweet and strong herbal and alcoholic. Full bodied. Very bitter and alcoholic.

Pours ruby with deep amber shades and a frothy beige/khaki head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, hops (somehow earthy), pine needles, honey, some dark fruits like raisins and dried plums. The flavour is awesome: tons of caramel malts up front, brown sugar, honey, dark fruits and in the end the hops come and clean the mouth leaving it dry and bitter. Superbly balanced. Medium to full body, almost oily texture. The best barley wine so far, together with Mikkellers Big Worse.
Bottle shared. great job ale smith making this hopped barley wine, full body, full flavor.

13ish years old bottle. Hazy brown, low head. Somewhat oxidized, but still nice enough notes - Prune malty, chocolate, roast, a hint estery play. Full thick on the palate, light minerally on the tongue.

Approx 2003-2004, thanks Jonas. Murky brown with not much of a head. Aroma is smooth milk chocolate (not too sweet) clove, slight roast. Taste is brown sugar sweetness with roasty phenolic bitterness. Intensely smooth and well rounded, not too much carbonation. Heavy and oily but still somehow drinkable, so smooth. Not bad at all. I love it!

(bottle, quite old) murky ruby-brown colour with a small frothy beige head. aroma of fudge and vanilla pudding, with some light notes of chocolate raisins, some brown sugar, light ethanol and earth. flavour is mostly roasted malts, some peppermint and ethanol, with some notes of palm leaves, toasted malts, caramelized pear and lots of orange juice in the light roasted-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with average carbonation. a little past its prime ...

Pours a dark coppery hazed color with off-white head. Caramel, dark fruits, toast, and some leather on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with more caramel and dark fruit sweetness.

On tap at Bloodhound Bar, Brisbane. Pours with nice copper hue and thin head but good lacing. Malty aroma mixed with earthy hops leading to rich taste profile from beginning to end. Malt sweetness eventually catches up to hop bitterness at the finish, overall an awesome brew.

(Bottle) murky, cloudy orange brown colour with a small beige head; rich aroma of jam, stewed fruit, brown sugar, spice; rich, balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish; thick palate, well hidden alcohol, very nice, great barley wine
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

0,75l bottle from Alko shared. Pours black colour with some head. Aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, sweetness, oak, alcohol, hops, some fruitiness. Thick body, somewhat bitter, long alcoholy and sweet aftertaste. Heavy beer.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, overripe fruit, orange, hops, citrus and alcohol.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/brown beer with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, overripe fruit and orange; ends slightly bitter and slightly/medium dry with hops, citrus and alcohol.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. The alcohol is noticeable all over, but manages to never becomes too dominant. All the ingredients shine through, with loads of caramel and hops. This makes the taste and palate extremely great. What a balanced Barley Wine and that is truly remarkable.

Simply brilliant beer. Beautiful to look at. Wonderful aroma escapes from the bottle when opened. Opaque Amber pour with 2 finger head. High carbonation and lots of lacing. Hop bitterness in the back end. Not too sweet. Nice nutty presence. Rating bottle from 11/15.

Dark copper pour with a cream colored head. Tons of lacing. Strong caramel aroma with earthy hops, burnt toast, and some dark fruit. Taste follows the nose but has boozy heat and metallic notes. Full chewy body.
On tap at Draft Bar on Mission Beach. Murky russet amber. I let it warm a while. Rich sugary malts. Earthy spice. Lots of layers. Mild bitter finish

Numbskull poured a deep brown-amber hued body, good carbonation with a thin white cap that left heavy laceing. Aroma was really nice lots of different fruit made an apperance pineapple, pear, cherry, citrus and alcohol. Flavors of chocolate, coffee at first and as it warmed the fruit flavors came into play, alcohol was noticeable throughout. Mouthfeel was thick and chewy, alcohol warms up the body some. Overall a very nice brew, cant wait to open my second one later. Originally rated on 10/13/08.

Poured from a bottle. Medium copper color, medium frothy white head. Sweet hops and syrup aroma. Medium body with a sweet malt flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of plums, toffee and caramel, pours a hazy copper color. A great taste of fruit, caramel and malt, full body with a fermented fruit and booze finish.

Bottle from Specs. Deep dark mahogany with a milky cream colored head with light lacing. Aroma of fig, caramel, grass, white cake, and a hint of apple. Taste is sweet caramel and dark fruit and bread and a fair amount of bitterness. Alcohol is pretty well integrated, but theres no doubt its there. Medium-full bodied and quite smooth. Nice.
750ml bottle. Dark amber body with a low head. Dried dark fruits, caramel, toffee, pine, biscuit. Hint of lactose towards finish. Noticable alcohol presence.

In the glass it has a dark coppery amber color with a beige, creamy and lasting foam. Roasted notes on the nose, cake, candy with fruity nuances and slightly milder hops and alcohol appreciated. In the mouth it is silky but dry, bitter aftertaste. Does not hide very well integrated alcohol which include shades of caramel, biscuit and some roasted towards the end.
This is a case of a beer, while good, not living up to the expectations at all. Sweet but not much molasses. Not my favorite by a bit.

Esters. Dates. Plums. Toffee. Pours a muddy murky dark tan with sediment floating in it and a light tan thin quickly fading head. Thick mouthfeel. Hard candy. Toffee. Fruit. Raisins. Dates. Very sweet with just a bit of bitterness on the finish. A little spice. A little booze.

750 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy amber with a medium white head. Strong malty aroma of caramel, resin, bread, rasins, milk chocolate; moderate hoppy with notes of grass and pine. Taste reflects the aroma. Medium body, with a creamy texture. Low carbonation. Medium bitterness.

Aromas are heavily malt dominated - caramel and to feeling. 

Color is a dark copper with a small off-white head.

Taste us quite sweet with a fairly pronounced but generalized bitterness.

Alcohol is pronounced; carbonation is a bit lively; finish is long, with lots of malt.

Overall a good solid barleywine.

Una exquisita cerveza. Compleja tanto en sabor como en aroma. Destacan las notas a frutos secos. Higo y pasas principalmente. Las notas a grano están muy presentes.

De color cobrizo, carbonatacion baja, corona de espuma ligera.

Un sabor complejo y bien integrado.
Bottle. Pours a reddish copper color. Aroma and taste are caramel, toffee, and lots go hops.

Draft at the source on 6/30/2016. Clear amber with a beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, and booze with faint notes of citrus and pine. Taste is malt, caramel, alcohol, toffee, dark fruits, bread, and hints of citrus/pine from the hops. Quite enjoyable.

Kirkas punertavankuparinen olut melko runsaalla ja kestävällä vaaleanbeigellä vaahdolla. Tuoksu sitruksinen ja havuinen, jopa hieman savuinen, makean maltainen ja karamellinen. Maku havuinen, maltainen, hieman karamellinen. Lievää sitruksista hedelmäisyyttä löytyy myös. Keskitäyteläistä hieman täyteläisempi suutuntuma, hiilihappoja hyvin vähänlaisesti. Pehmeä ja monimuotoinen, oikein nautittava Barley Wine.
Very sweet almost syrupy in texture. Maybe more of an English style barley wine. Enjoyed At the brewery

Torpedo bottle. Amber color with a generous head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, and slight dark fruits. Medium Heavy body. Creamy texture. Warming alcohol. Nice mouthfeel. This a BIG BEER. A big malt bomb with some hops in the background to ease it out. Pretty good stuff.
Bottle. Reddish amber with a tiny off white head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, caramel, fruit and hops. Full body with a long bitter/ fruity finish.

Bottle from 2012. Shared with a friend. Its been at my parents house since christmas 2012..
Colour is deep red-ish brown. Small beige head. Complex aroma of dried fruits, figs, dates, orange, caramel, toffee, coffee, cognac, nuts, port wine, yeast, wood, pepper. 
Sweet taste, low/medium bitterness, long and almost dry finish. Full body, sticky texture. Carbonation was soft to medium.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2016 Clearish brown. Slightly hoppy. What. Some licorice and ripe fruits... but very some. I?ve drank this earlier and this was better back in the day. Waterish, but strong. Yet weak body. Maybe served too cold, needs further studies.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2016 On tap at Alesmith brewpub. Dark bronze. Light malty aroma. Huge booze bomb in your face. Fuck balance this guy screws your Mom and then puts alcohol in your iv. Really strong. Like sipping hard liquor. Wayy too hard. Not my thing. Could be I tasted too many leading up to this, but I like barleywines and this one is not the best example of the style. Otherwise this brewery is solid.

Pours clear deep copper with medium beige head. Nose is honey and Aromas are toasted malts, honey, ripe fruits, spices, leather and alcoholic notes. Average carbonation, medium body. Long spicy and alcoholic finish.
Bottled 75 cl. Color : very nice red copper ale with thick white head. Nose : honey, toffee and raisins. Aromas : honey, alcohol and raisins. Low bitterness, sweety texture.

Vintage 2015. 
APARIENCIA: de color marrón cobrizo, con destellos rojizos a contraluz, se observa muy ligeramente turbia y moderada a baja actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color beige de buena retención, de burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: se aprecian notas a coco, vainilla, chocolate, frutos oscuros como dátiles e higos, caramelo, ligeramente se aprecian los lúpulos con notas cítricas y herbales.

SABOR: de entrada un amargor medio ligero, seguido de frutos oscuros que predominan con notas a higos y dátiles, seguido de notas a vainilla, coco, ligeramente chocolate dulce, nueces, los lúpulos de carácter cítrico con notas a cáscara de toronja, naranja el cual me llega a recordar al licor Cointreau o Grand Marnier, y notas herbales, que conforme toma temperatura ambiente va siendo más notorio, también el caramelo y toffee están presentes; el retrogusto queda un amargor medio ligero, seco y sensación cálida en garganta al correr el líquido.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero, ligeramente oleoso/untuoso, carbonatación media.

RESUMEN: buen y bastante complejo barleywine.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Old Numbskull by AleSmith Brewing Company at PowiśleIntensywne, geste, lepkie, zywiczne, przejrzale owoce tropikalne, trawiaste, ciut miodowe, ciut karmelowe, ciut alkoholu, slodkie... Klasa!Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Fles gekocht bij firmabier.nl, gedeeld en uitgeschonken in 33 cl. Struise glazen. Donker amberkleurig troebel bier, met een roodachtige gloed en een volle beige schuimkraag. De aroma’s zijn eerst heel hoppig, en fruitig met tonen van grapefruit, met als basis vooral de karamel en toffee, gedroogde perziken, verder donker fruit, als rozijnen en gedroogde pruimen en aardachtige tonen, van vochtig hout en paddestoelen. Het smaakpallet is een voortzetting van de aroma's, typische Amerikaanse hoppige Barley Wine, met complexe tonen. Bitterzoete tonen van grapefruit, uitstekend gebalanceerd door meer moutige karamel en toffee tonen, aardse kruidige notities en donker fruit. Milde carbonatie en lange peperige afdronk met een verwarmende finish. Dit was het eerste bier van Ale Smith wat ik proef, deze Old Numbskull, een zeer smakelijke en complexe Barley Wine. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 9, 2016 Bottle of one and a half year old. American style barley wine with thick, moussy, quite stable, yellowish beige head and equally misty, deep amberish copper robe. Complex aroma of American cookies, biscuit, gingerbread, Cointreau, brown rhum, candied orange, mouldy grapefruit, lychee, caramel, chestnut, wet leather, pepper, hay, peach, strawberry, old cocoa powder and a bit of damp cellar in the end. Soft, sweetish fruity onset with estery hints of Cantaloupe, strawberry, passion fruit and lychee surrounded by a certain mushroom-like umaminess, soft carbo, vinous and fluffy, almost quad-like mouthfeel, bit powdery, built on a thick layer of caramelly and bready malt sweetness with softly bittering toasted edges, while the finish adds earthy, peppery, leafy hops with retronasal dried grapefruit peel fragrance but mildly so, as well as quite a lot of peppery, brandy-like alcohol, becoming a bit tiring and even slightly astringent on the tongue in the end, but providing a great deal of afterwarmth. Nice and complex, interesting, but somehow it lacks the dignity of the best barley wines of this world (think Sucaba and the like); still, I think with some years of cellaring, this has great flavor potential.  In terms of style, I think this is closer to English barley wine than to true American barley wine, if such a thing is to be recognized in the first place...

Oh my. This is what a barleywine should be, every single time. Pours a lighter copper than the taste that follows. Rich, dark, intensely concentrated plummy fruits, beautifully balanced by an aggressive but pleasing bitterness. Lots of spicy notes along with toasted malt, caramel, lots going on. Boozy, bold, rich. One of my favorites.

Deep red color, big light orange head. Beautiful, intense sweet aroma: raisins, pine, caramel, toffee. Sweet with medium bitter. Very well hidden alcohol. Light carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel. Extremely enjoyable beer, worth of its price.

Bottle. Pours a perfect copper, small carbonation, creamy head, loads of lacing being left behind. Nose is pure caramel and toffee. Tastes sweet, almost reminiscent, bitter, but it doesnt last long. Good ABV bite. This is gold.

Bottle, shared by me... in the library... just now.
Pours a deep red almost crimson color with a reasonable sized head and some touches of lacing on the glass.

The aroma is pleasantly sweet and has lovely red apple and toffee notes as well as some light piney hop character, as it warms the bouquet opens up with chocolate, some light nuttiness, and a bit of orange peel. 

The flavor has a medium level of bitterness and is pretty sweet, not cloying, but certainly sweet. Its got flavors of chocolate, caramel, rich toasted malt, nuttiness, and a bit of citrus and earthy hop zing. Its really impossibly rich malt wise, but somehow all balanced out to being enormously pleasant. 

Ive grown so skeptical of American Style Barleywine, but this is just wonderful, an absolute benchmark for the style.

Big bottle purchased at Surdys a few months back. Saved for March Madness consumption which is successfully being achieved today on the opening night of the Sweet Sixteen. Shared with commonshawn. Kind of a murky, coppery color with a half finger off white head. Aroma features burnt caramel and toffee and hints at the booziness of the beer you are about to consume. Taste has a nice toasted/burnt sugar quality to it with nearly a bourbon characteristic. Alcohol is definitely present and it comes through more and more with each sip. Warming mouthfeel with a finish of raisins and bitterness reminding me ever so slightly of a Belgian dubbel. Overall, its very tasty but almost a little too booze-heavy for me. Other barleywines seem to be a little bit better balance. Still significantly above average.

Bottle shared at the 2015 edition of the chriso Pre-GBBF tasting - London. Cheers! Pours clear, reddish gold with a creamy, khaki head. The nose holds old pine, toasted grains, crackers, dried out caramel. Medium sweet flavour with lots of graham cracker, dried fruits, alcohol, bread. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Warming finish with more graham crackers, pine and dried fruits. Very tasty overall.

Backlog 2015-06-05
Lots of dried fruits and sweetness to it. Probably a great barley wine, but I prefer the BA versions... A bit overwhelming and boozy for me.

Type: 8-oz. draft
Glass: Clear snifter glass 
From: AleSmith Tasting Room in San Diego, Calif.
Price: $4.25
Purchased: March 7, 2016
Consumed: March 7, 2016
Misc.: Reviewed after picking up Port Wine Barrel Wee Heavy

I had this a few times on tap (tasters) at AleSmith, but this would be my first time reviewing it. Wanted to have this so that I could eventually have Reforged, a blend of this, Wee Heavy and Speedway Stout. 

Poured an auburn, amber murky color with 2-to-3 fingers of khaki tan, rocky head when I got it. Good amount of spotty, foamy lacing on the sides of the glass. Excellent retention. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled sugary caramel, toffee, Citra, orange creamscicle, brown sugar, hints of butterscotch, dark fruits and peppery spices. Smooth for an American Barleywine and not too hoppy. (Smell - 4.00)

Taste follows the nose, but probably served a tad too cold. Toffee, caramel, light butterscotch, boozy hoppiness, honey, orange zest, Citra hops, oakiness, some spicy pepper, hints of dark fruits and some dry leather. (Taste - 3.75)

Medium body. Sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, boozy finish. (Feel - 3.50)

This was pretty good for an American Barleywine. Id have it again. (Overall - 3.75)

3.80 86 B+

750no wine bottle into wine glass. Red copper color, nice cream head that retains. Slightly spicy nose, if blind tasting Ive Sid IPA. Light fruit as week, maybe peach? In the mouth, surprisingly light for the style and alcohol. More cinnamon/ginger sense, and the typical slightly copying malty finish. I dont usually much like bsrleywines but I kind of like this.

Degustowane w większym gronie więc opis wrażeń raczej bardziej ogólny. Aromat bardzo przyjemny lecz trudny do zdefiniowania w warunkach tamtej degustacji. W smaku ciemne owoce (śliwka, rodzynki) i dużo, dużo toffi. Ciałko idealne chociaż trudno powiedzieć o tym piwie, że jest gęste. Bardzo, bardzo pijalne. Świetne piwo.

Opened this baby up after 14 months of aging. Some sediment in bottom of bottle. Poured with a light tan head that turns lacey on edge soon. Nose is a subtle sweet grass. Initial mouth feel a bit sharp but still smooth for the ALC %. Sweet front pallet with some fig taste and a subtle finish of malt with a bit of bitterness.

Raisins, peaches, caramel, brown, white head, frothy head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter. Beautifully balanced aroma; fruity and malty. Attractive head. Maltiness more pronounced on the tongue, thankfully, as it balances the sweetness. Medium bodied, pairing well with a variety of foods. Full aftertaste, yet disappears appropriately. Very, very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 750mL bottle, poured into a Teku glass. The aroma is toffee, grape juice, and honey that turns to caramel and floral pine by mid bottle, and finally turns towards toast and honey. It pours a brilliant, clear, deep rich copper color with an oil-like quality. It?s topped by a mild, khaki soap head that has a filmy surface with overall good retention and lace. The taste is highly sweet and bitter, more sweet of balanced upfront with a bitter leaning towards the end. The texture is thick, smooth syrup with a soft foam carbonation and full malty body. The flavor profile is malty caramel, floral resin, and dark fruit with a smooth finish characterized by clean floral and a pine resin flourish with mellow burnt sugar chalky and a slight leather mouthfeel. The aftertaste is clean and woody with rye whiskey, caramel, rye bread, and light pine.

Old rating rerated 30.01.2016, 0,75l bottle shared with friends:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry mineraly, burnt sugar, bark, alcohol, grass, hops, old leafs, weeds, minerals, hints of thinner. Taste is sweet grassy, leafs, sugar, grass, weeds, bark, alcohol, hops, citrus peel, dried fruits, minerals. Medium to longlasting bitterness, sweet and harsh grassy mouthfeel. Fair enough.

750 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 for his 750th rating. What a nice break from the dumpsters. The pour is a nice light ruby colored red with a light khaki colored head that falls down to a bubbly head, leaving some pretty good lace. The aroma is pretty hoppy. There is a nice maltiness that's present, but I am a little surprised it's more bitter than sweet, especially after having had a couple of the barreled versions. The flavor is much more bitter than I want it to be. There is a lot of bitter hops and it's really lacking a sweet caramel malt. The mouth feel is excellent. There is a great viscosity and a creamy soft carbonation. The aftertaste is lingeringly bitter with a decent malt profile trying to poke through, but it's not working. A decent barleywine for sure, but it's too different than the BA ones for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

#750. Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is caramel, toffee, dark fruit, malt, hops, very nice. Appearance is reddish brown, light tan head, real nice. Taste is very balanced, a bit of toffee and caramel, a lot of malt and hop bitterness, layered with nothing really standing out. Mouthfeel is heavy with a soft carbonation, the flavor that lingers is not bitter but quite malty. Overall, I expected it to be better but Im not real disappointed either.

I dont have barleywines too often,so take my opinions with a grain of salt. Lots of caramel, toffee, sweetness thats not cloying, minor bitterness. Quite easy drinking for a barleywine. As per usual for this style, the ABV is quite obvious.

Cannery Row enjoys Barleywine beers tonight. This is a nice but seems to be a young beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Red body with a creamy head.
Sweet, vinous aroma and flavour, with a full caramel malt and hops character. Rich and complex taste, with warming alcohol. Heavy sweetness and bitterness. Long, bittersweet finish.
Full body with a silky mouthfeel and soft carbonation.

Well balanced and incredibly delicious barley wine.

A barley wine, mint olyan, ha jól van elkészítve, mondhatjuk, már eleve súlyos egy kategória Amit azonban az Alesmith hozott elő a stílusból, az valóban nem ismer könyörületet, mintha a szakkönyvek által meghatározott tipológiabeli sajátosságok egyszerre jelennének meg elemi erővel, ebben a sörben aztán minden benne van, amit az ember egy árpabortól elvár. Mély beütésű réz színe már önmagában masszivitást üvölt a levegőbe, miután pedig a kupak is lekerül az üvegről, egyszer csak elszabadul a pokol... Lehengerlő súlyú aromafergeteg tör elő, magán hordozva természetesen mindent, ami komlóhoz köthető, az angolszász vonalak szinte kidagadnak, amint a fűszeres, vadvirágos, aszalt zöldséges illatjegyek lüktetni kezdenek bennük. Az intenzív ízek netovábbja elevenedik meg aztán, kikezdhetetlen formátumú, utánozhatatlanul tartalmas kekszes malátafolyam, melynek minden cseppje mondanivalóval telt, élettel teli és vibráló, a vaskos vonalakkal meghúzott kép kontúrjait pedig tovább erősíti a komló erőtől duzzadó karaktere, tartalmas, kiegyensúlyozottan intenzív kesernyéje, mely által a szerkezet e két tengely mentén egyensúlyozva hirdeti magán a komló-és malátaközpontú műfajok minden erényét. Kifogástalan barley wine.

Pours a brown body with a thick beige head. Rich creamy aroma. Taste with malt, sugary esters and some bread.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle bought in Seattle, taken in Alaskan cruise. Dark amber in color. Good carbonation for barrel-aged ale. Aroma of whiskey from barrel aging over a good quality ale. Very enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

3 yr old bottle. Dark amber with a small beige head that leaves a ton of lacing. The aroma is a nice mix of caramel and toast, a bit of dark fruit notes, with a hint of sherry from oxidation. The flavor is even better, with a nice smooth mouthfeel. Seems like the aging has obviously removed the hops, but really mellowed the alcohol judging from other ratings, as it is very subtle. Really great barleywine. Will have to try fresh.
Bottle shared at Beer for Geeks Tasting Room. Slightly hoppy aroma. Sweet. Nice but not lasting.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2016 Had 2012 - #CraftTakesSeattle Day 2, Beer 32 - Draught at Brouwers Cafe. Aged beautifully, lots of floral aromatics and soft, dark fruit notes.

Rating #1544 - 20.03.2015 - Birthday Brewery tour. 2014 on tap @Alesmith. Hazy orange-brown pour, bubbly head, not much lacing. Aroma is sweet sweet citrus and honey - mango, peach, vanilla. Taste is an alcoholic hoppy punch, lots of IBUs tempered with sweetness, and a ton of alcohol on the palate, but not thoroughly undisguised. Just a big bold beer for flavour-lovers. Awesome. 9-4-9-5-18

Bottled on 05/11/15.
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a semi-hazy burnt amber color with a thin white slim little head. Lacing was filmy and glossy along the glass.
The smell started off with leafy tobacco aroma up front. Subtle citrus hops invade light toffee and caramel malts. Crisp yet sweet and dry fruity esters slyly move in.
The taste was moderately dry with a subtle sweet dry caramel to toffee. Subtle dried fruit rides underneath. Dry semi-sweet caramel to fruity to toffee aftertaste subtly moving into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about about a medium on the body with a good sipping quality about it. Carbonation rides in subtly and nicely, allows a super big stickiness, almost cloying, but not.
Overall, as an American Barleywine it works, theres some hops in the aroma that seem a bit further back but due to the age on the beer, Im not worried and didnt cut back. Its good for what it is and Id have again.

Coppery red colored, clear, small off white to beige frothy head. Aroma is of sweet caramel, toffee, dried fruits, bit spice, herbal and pine hops. Taste is very sweet and malty, quite caramelish and toffee, very dried fruity, moderate floral and pine hops, medium- bitterness, some spices, quite boozy with alcohol warmth finishing up. Full bodied, soft carbonation, thick and syrupy.

Pours reddish copper with a one finger off white head with good lacing. Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, sweet malts, pine, herbal notes, butterscotch, and some light booze. Taste is similar to the aroma. Has a medium-full body with a creamy, sticky mouthfeel and a semi bitter, semi warming, long, lingering finish. Overall, s tasty, complex barley wine that hides its high abv very well.

750 ml bottle. Pours a clear orange amber with a nice white head. Aroma is roast, caramel, tobacco. Flavor is tobacco, roasted caramel, brown sugar. Finish is herbal, tobacco, grapefruit and lemon notes. Full body, soft mouthfeel and average carbonation.

Bottle from Texas Liquors, shared at the holiday party 
Clear golden with a medium sized beige head, some lacing. Aroma is caramel and nutty. Taste of caramel, malty and hot alcohols 
Good. Ive had this for a few years, it could have used a few more.

pours unclear medium dark copper, orange-red tint, with a light beige cap, reviving and leaving nice lacing. sweetish toasted fruitiness, tasty red maltiness, chocolate hint, stone fruits, floral resin, warming booze, umami - salty beef stock, hint of smoke. moderately low carbonation, medium body - oily; semi-sweet woodsy-chocolate-resinous finish. opulent maltiness - american hopped and lightly smoked chocolate barley wine. very nice stuff!
caramel, alcohol, floral, toast, dried fruits, amber, hazy, frothy, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Large Bottle to glass. Warm brown clear appearance. Moderate head. Aroma of caramel, toast, Heath bar, dark cherry. Really nice balance of sweet intense malts and a solid hop bitterness. Warming alcohol. Nicely carbonated.

2012 vintage. Thanks Keven for sharing. Fun to try and surprising that this is my firsr experience with this beer. Pours a cloudy brown with a lasting fizz head. Toasty flavor throughout, and very mellow. Has settled in time im sure. Hoppy finish. Delicious.
Couleur dun ambree assez foncee avec une mousse qui tien plus ou moins. En bouche cest plutot decevant, caramel, fruits rouges, herbes et alcool....

Nice mellow honey and caramel flavors. This was a bit yeasty due to someone putting it on its side and this was about two years old .

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle. Hazy red Amber color with an off white head with a lot of head retention. Sweet plum caramel alcohol malt aroma. Caramel toffee raisin spice malt flavor. Heavy sticky body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2009 vintage

Pours a dark chestnut brown color with mahogany edges and a two finger, yellowish-beige head that slowly settles into a lasting ring. Sporadic streaks of soapy lacing left behind. Surprisingly carbonated considering the style and high alcohol content. 

Sweet yet earthy aroma with a nice balance of sweet and leathery malt, dark fruit and alcohol. Hints of caramel, toffee, plum, raisin, booze and subtle earthy hops. Theres plenty of boozy sweetness in the nose but it doesnt overpower letting the toffee, dark fruit and sweeter malt notes stand out. 

Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a decent amount of boozy sweetness that lingers over the strong malt flavors and earthy hops into a warm finish. Dry, earthy hops up front are somewhat stale/faded but the flavor is still there, adding complexity to this intense beer. Earthy and leathery malt compliment the hops befoe being countered by toffee, fig, raisin and caramel sweetness. Theres plenty ofvalcohol sweetness and warmth in the finish but its not overly hot and the high ABV is relatively well masked. Well balanced and complex but definitely a sipper. Im glad I sat on this one for a while because its drinking very nicely 3+ years later.
Bottle. Amber pour with an off-white head. Iced tea notes, a bit of raisin and fruit, nice balance of sweetness and surprisingly hoppy for a barleywine.

75cl bottle shared at home. Dark mahogany with a medium slightly off-white head. Full body with low to moderate carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Malts, caramel, alcohol, herbs, oak, dark fruits and brown sugar. 
This brew was quite malty but still very well balanced, great beer.

Bomber shared and wow. Poured a clear medium Amber/orange with off white head. The aroma is amazing. Caramel, toffee, alcohol, sweet malts, dark fruits. The flavor is much more of the same and a lot more. I call it a caramel alcohol slide with droplets of dark fruits. This is so smooth I can only wonder what happens to this as it ages. A very smooth alcohol warmth from tongue to belly, the overall flavor is so good and blended so well this is one amazing barley wine.
Solid ass beer...more hops than i expected...different flavors with every sip...top notch brewer no doubt....

Backlog rating. Keg at BD Shoreditch, London. it pours a dark copper / mahogany color with medium beige head. Aroma is sweet and fruity, with caramel, dark fruits, melon, toffee. Taste has more sweet bready malts, toffee, dark fruits, dates. Medium to full bodies with good carbonation. Overall, sweet and bold, hides ABV well

Clear copper colour white head. Aroma is a good mix of sweet and bitter notes. Taste is medium bitterness with slightly lower sweetness. Palate is soft carbonation, creamy, medium body, long sweet finish with balancing bitterness.hints of oak and caramel.
Bottle. Dark reddish brown color, white head. Aroma has sweet fruits, some hops, caramel. Sweet body, great balance, suprisingly high hops at the end.
750ml->snifter. Deep copper with thick lite tan head. A: loads of caramel malt, honey, toffee. T: bittersweet caramel malt, nread, figs, herbs. Rich. Very good.

Botella 75 cl tomada en el Lupulo en varias veces última en julio 2014. (r1397). Sin lote ni fecha en Botella. Antiguo etiquetado. Increíble barley Si me con buen cuerpo y sensación alcohólica. Para repetir sin duda otra vez más.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2017 Re-rate after 3rd bottle: first was 4.4, second one 4.2, final 3rd: 4.0
Pours amberish light brown, with large off-white tan head.
Clarity is brilliant with small, slow rising bubbles.
Aroma is without note of an alcohol, fruity, slightly floral, with rich sweet caramelly maltiness.
Flavor: strong, malt flavor, balanced with hop flavor and strong, almost agressively bittermess. Malt sweetness is moderately high, caramelly and slightly bready, hop bitterness is high, with modetate hop flavor and moderate fruity esters. Alcohol note is obvious but perfectly integrated.
Body is full, sticky, smooth. Carbonation is low.

Aroma: caramel, dark fruits, citrus, pine, earthy
Appearance: clear copper, tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Outstanding.

Robe ambrée légèrement trouble surmontée dun col de mousse beige dense, laiteux et luisant. Dentelle epaisse et collante. Arômes de malt caramélisé, houblons côte ouest. Orange, pêche, pamplemousse et mangue. Un beau fond de sucre dorge et toffee. Nez superbe, doux et intense. Les effluves sont équilibrées. En bouche, saveurs de mal caramélisé et sucre dorge accompagnés de houblons frais dagrumes. Pamplemousse, orange, mangue. Une belle finale mélangeant sucre dorge et amertume de houblon. Haut taux dalcool imperceptible. Équilibre superbe. Texture moyennement onctueuse et bonne rondeur. Un barleywine américain dans les règles de lart.

Bottle.Deep copper colour with small head.Aroma is smooth toasted and malty with good full body and sweet taste of dark dried fruits plum and prune,nice warming mouthfeels and good taste of toffee caramel and malt.

750mL bottle. Deep honey-gold pour, creamy white head (exceptional retention for the style actually). Nose is apricot, caramel, leathery notes, Froot Loops, some boozy alcohol. Mouth is sticky on the palate, some dried fruit, custard, toffee, butter, oak, slight metallic bitterness towards the warm finish. My first AleSmith brew. Decent. Hardly the best barleywine Ive had, but still good.

75cl bottle shared in a snifter. Pours dark amber almost garnet colour with a beige head which lasts well. Aroma is sweet fruits with honey and caramel notes and a slight hoppy astringency. Taste is massively complex - every mouthful is different. Very much worthwhile starting (slightly) over-chilled to appreciate the evolution throughout the drink (it is a sipper so this is easily possible). A lemon sherbet-like sweetness with the honeyed stone fruits (peaches, apricots) give way to a hoppy profile but a surprising lack of bitterness which is most welcome with some of the barley wines I have tried recently being more of a malty IIPA than a barley wine. Truly fantastic and I can only imagine the bourbon barrel aged version (which I am currently cellaring) being world-class.

.75 bottle. Deep amber, browny notes, pretty clear. Very nice deep roasty sugary caramels, dried fruits, figsy, slight plummy, malty. Full bodied, slight herby, good soft bitters. A really nicely balanced drink. Good bitters, soft smooth. Dark dry fruityness.-- bb

Aroma: Caramel, Sweet Bready, Boozy

Appearance: Orangish/Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, Off Yellow Head Ring, Minimal Lacing

Taste: Caramel, Medicinal Alcohol, Mildly Metallic

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Boozy, Mildly Bitter

Bottle. Pours amber with medium yellowish head. Aroma is sweetish, caramel, malty, grassy, toffee. Taste is medium sweet and slightly bitter, toffee, caramel, grass.. Medium + body. Well balanced. Good beer.

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen - amber brown coloured pour with big off-white head. Medium sweet malty aroma and taste, toasty, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, dried fruity,nutty, some great spices in there medium sweet bitter finish. Top notch BW!

Draft at Ynot chesapeake. Pours a mostly clear light amber color with a light tan head. Aroma of caramel, molasses, dark fruits. Big thick mouthfeel, but creamy and smooth. Overall a pretty solid barleywine.
monster of a barleywine. very xomplex, notes of caramel and chocolate in this one. pours reddish brown with a thick lacey head. had a bottle share with feezor during our draft. smells like chocolate.

750ml bottle enjoyed @ a friends cottage. Pours clear red amber with a foamy off-white head. Aroma is hoppy, caramel, nutty and dark dried fruits. Flavour is sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied, thick texture, soft carbonation. Finish is bittersweet and fruity.

Draft to tulip
Bourbon, red wine, a hint of yeast. 
Deep red, no head, no effervescence. Taste is red grape, cherry, bourbon.

Bottle at HChris and Ruths pre-GBBF 2015. Deep amber beer with an beige head. Fruity , malty, dark dried fruits, caramell aroma. Hoppy, malty nutty dark fruits flavour. Really a marvellous palette of aroma and flavour. So complexed beer.
UPDATED: OCT 23, 2016 Strong notes of spicy tobaco, honey and ripe fruit. A lot of hoppy character as well. Almost perfect ballance between sweetness and bitterness. Lovely.

Courtesy of Jaghana
Couleur ambrée sombre, très légère mousse. Fort nez houblonné fruité exoxtique, note resineuse et sucrée. Fort gout houblonné résineux, fruits exotiques legerement confits, agrumes confites; orange, fruits jaunes, notes de reglisse, caramel, raisins et légères épices. Bon corps. Fin longue résineuse et fruitée. Intense et complexe, une nouvelle bombe de alesmith. On dirait une imperial ipa.

Bottle 75cl, a dark amber beer with good head. Nose is intense on exotic fruits and candied fruits / ripped fruits. Aroma is on his on hops resin, licorice, candied fruits, dry grapes, mango, mandarin, apricot, toffee, quite sweet, toasted caramel, quite bitter, good complexity. Body is a bit too sweet on my point of view, robust barley, long fruity aftertaste, vanilla hints.

Bottle shared at Chrisos pre-GBBF 2015 Shindig, bought at Brewdogs online shop. 2 or 3 years old. Colour is rusty red orange, white head. Nose is musty grain, sweet and sugary, barley sugar sweets, marmalade, orange peel, little spice, leather. Taste is marmlade, musty grain, orange peel, caramel, bitter citrous peel. Its not too raw, but is soft and mellow. Im getting a nice fug of warmth up the back of my head as I drink this. Rich soft, fruity and sweet, but not cloying at all. Very good barley wine.

750 ml bottle at home - latest vintage. Pours dark copper amber with a stable off-white head. Rich nutty and raisin aroma, hops are coming through very well; verydense exotic. Full rich sweet and bitter body, flirting with the IIPA limit. A tad alcoholic, aggressive towards the end. Taste is tangerine peel, nuts, brown Sugar, alcohol.
Dark copper color white off white head clear, some what earthy hoppy aroma along with a great light biscuit sense. Flavor big rich malty and great hop backbone.
Bottle at home. Full rich flavour with a nice hop presence. Caramel, vanilla, dark fruits, cinnamon.. sugar and spice, all things nice. Tastes more sweet than bitter. full body. Thoroughly enjoyed.
Fantastic aroma of malt and hops. The taste is however dominated in a bad way by burnt caramel. Medium sweet finish.
Bottle at home. Pours deep amber, nose is malty toffee, little meaty, taste is dry, light smoke toffee, sweet. Was expecting a bit more tbh.

Now this is what I call a barleywine! A masterpiece.Everything it says on the label and more. Astonishingly well-balanced. Extremely well hidden alcohol. Hops are aggressive, but do not take the center stage - this is a malt-forward beer. Leather, tobacco, autumn leaves, dried fruits, burnt caramel. Viscous, oily, almost syrupy body. Strong bitter finish counterbalances malt sweetness. Note: my bottle is ~1.5 years old (bottled Feb 2014).

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2016 Taster at the brewery. Amber color with fine beige ring. American hops in the aroma, plus caramel and berries. Taste is malty, not too sweet, candied sugar, dried fruit, oranges, tangerines, a bit booze, but stays balanced. Smooth mouthfeel. Not what you?d expect from a Barleywine, Alesmith takes balance to a whole new level.Some ~10 year old bottle. Oxidized, but very good and still balanced.
A supremely drinkable barley wine, with major hop influence, that cuts through the sweet malt notes. Very good .
Copper colour, beige head, very intense aroma of toffee, caramel and hops. Taste is medium sweet, full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Very intense taste.

Bottle. The pour is a nice amber color. The aroma is mostly toffee, plums, and dark fruits. The taste is big on toffee, great american barleywine. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tab at CBC 2015. Clear orange colour with a small off-white head. Aroma and flavor of dried fruit, alcohol, malt, caramel. hops and pine.

Bottle. Hazy red amber beer with a small white head. Aroma is malty with notes of caramel, citrus, peaches, oranges, herbs, vanilla and licorice. Flavor is malty with notes of caramel, oranges, apricot, herbs, vanilla and licorice. Well balanced.

Tap at brewery. Mahogany with thick off white head. Smells of mild alcohol. Super aggressive. Heavy alcohol, then sweet and syrupy raisin, then malty finish. Very full body and flavor. Not messing around. A rich barley wine.

Bottle at tasting. Copper color, small white head. Aroma of malt and sweet fruit. Taste is very sweet, with toffee, sweet fruit, booze, sticky raisin and again booze. This one is too simple and one dimensional, its mostly booze, malt and sweet raisin. Where are the hops?
Pours dark ruby/copper with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma of malt, citrus, caramel, pine. Taste follow. Full bodied. Very good balance. Bitter finish.

Smaksprøve fra Rune. Mørk gyldenbrun. Middels høyt skum med litt farge. Aroma av mørke plommer. Myk munnfølelse. Smaken søt frukt. Litt bitterhet setter inn etter hvert. Svakt tørr alkoholisk avslutning.

@green cbc 2015
very sweet, light bitter, medium body, expecting more from the abv and alesmith

On tap at BrewDogs Aberdeen pub. 
Ruby-copper body with a creamy tan head. Particularly good head for a barleywine. 
Boozy feel but alcohol is partly hidden in the taste. 
Medium-full body with near medium carbonation.
Draught at Harrys Hofbrau. Aromas of cherry! Sweet malt and alcohol. Clear amber with white head. Taste is layered complexity of dark fruit, wheat and alcohol.

Draught sample at CBC 2015. Deep copper colour with a thin, off-white head. Rich toffee and caramel malts. Taste is sweet. Full body an oily texture. Finishes slightly dry with rich caramel malts and fruity hints. Lovely BW.
At CBC. Poured deep orange amber with a tan ring. Aroma of sweet berries and caramel malt. Full body, flavour is moderately sweet berries and toffee, medium bitterness, dry finish.

Bottle at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours slightly hazy dark ruby. Nose is toffee, caramel, resinous hops, dark fruits, fruitcake. Taste is caramel, fruitcake, toffee, dark fruits, lightly boozy. Its like a hybrid between barley wine and scotch ale - in a best way.

Pours clear amber with small off white head. Smell like soda. Toffee, chocolate, roasted malt. Nice balance. Good assertive bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
One of the best American barley wines Ive tried. Amber color and spicy aroma, dark fruits. Taste is rich, not too sweet, malt and caramel, some toffee. Nice one.
Deep amber to red pour. Very clear with little head as I poured slow. Caramel malts, some raisin, and toffee then some nice earthy hop aroma. Flavors as balanced as nose with all the same.

I dont get everything it says on the bottle. However, the appearance is very good with nice frothy, long lasting, cream-colored head, plenty of lace, a a very clear honey amber color. Aroma is fresh hops, malt, caramel. Flavor gets more interesting while being similar to nose, brings some fruit, a see saw of sweetness and bitterness that is very long, but then has resin solvent flavor at the very end along with a wee bit of alcohol. Body is good but is interfered with the weird solvent/bitter. Overall a powerhouse that I think would be better as it gets warmer.

Poured from a big 2013 bottle with a dark blue neck. Deep copper-red body. Stable fawn-coloured head. Toffee, bread and dried fruity aromas. Quite rich taste of apricot, dark fruits, vanilla, almond, bread and caramel. Lingering bittersweet ending supported by a controlled input of alcohol. Full bodied. Decent Saturday night sipper (Tromsø 18.04.2015).

Bottle from 2011. Pour is brown/red with a small tan head that fades quickly. Aroma and flavor of dark caramel, chocolate covered raisins, fruity ester, plums, oak, and slight spice. Finish is sweet and spicy with a slight alcohol burn.

Bottle at home, split with JFK, 03/04/15.
Lightly hazed amber with a decent beige covering that retains well.
Nose is rich dark fruits, spice, orange peel, fruit cake mix, caramel fudge, vanilla. 
Taste comprises candied fruit peel, caramel, Xmas cake, dates, orange marmalade, light booze. 
Full bodied, oily, booze fumes in a drying close.
Solid stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Niewidoczna data zabutelkowania. Szkło: Snifter. Barwa brązowa wpadająca w czerwień. Piana bogata, kremowa, pozostawiająca potężny lacing na szkle. Aromat, piękny kwiatowy, słodki, owoców tropikalnych. Piwo jest bardzo tresciwe, gęste, podczas picia sprawia wrażenie, że można by je gryźć. W smaku słodkie, na pierwszym planie tofi, goryczka srednia i przyjemna. Jest wspaniałe.

Always thought Bigfoot was litmus test n this style. This one is way over top with complex deliciousness. Dark fruits some fruity esters along with a good hop presence. Flavors of complex toffee malts caramel hops and some biscuit. Finish is as good as flavor lingering on to a great olfactory sense of all stated before!

Bottle purchased at Friar Tuck (Peoria), about 10 months old. I can smell this beer from 6 feet away. One of the greatest aromas ever. Malt sweetness, honey, raisin, plum, oak, cinnamon/spice, and some booziness. Looks amazing too. Beautiful reddish amber color that you can almost see through. Creamy off-white/tan head that leaves a ton of lacing. Taste is creamy smooth immediately up front, and then it all hits you. Sharp hop bitterness with a decent malt backbone supporting it. I am also getting oak and tobacco. Booze burn at the end, but just enough to not overwhelm the other flavors. Definitely a strong tasting barleywine. Palate is absolutely spot on. So smooth, carbonation is just right - its there, but it doesnt get in the way. Great barleywine; worthy of the rating.

75cl bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 

Pours dark brown with an amber hue. No head. 

Aroma is very complex. Dark fruits, charred oak, caramel, earthy notes, malty. Really nice. 

Taste is mildly sweet. A little bitter. 

Palate is full. Light carbonation. Very long finish. 

Overall, I really enjoyed this beer. Very complex.

Pours hazy mahogany with pale buff head. aroma has strong woody and fruity notes. Flavor has woody, caramel and malty notes plus a snip of caramel. Texture has average viscosity but good fizz,leaving a woody finish.

Draft at 2014 Yokohama Beer Fest. Bourbon-ish orange color with a thin, off-white head. Dried fruit, currant, fig with hints of toffee, caramel and praline all on the nose. Tastes more of the same with cinnamon, cardamom, pepper and ginger coming out as it warms up to room temperature. Slightly sweet on the palate at first, then the spices kick in and some bitterness creeps up on the finish. Still a smooth finish however. Solid barley wine.

Bomber to a snifter at home. The freezing rain is keeping me inside on the first day of March... A copper amber color with one finger khaki head and speckled lacing. Toast, sweet toffee, floral notes and some earthy qualities. Complex flavors, well balanced and hides the ABV... Delicious!  Halfway through the second glass and my skull is in fact numb ...

Pours a clear copper from the bottle with thin bubbly off-white head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of big caramel malt and vanilla overt dark fruit and earthiness. Taste is nice bitter sweet caramel and toffee. Nice stuff, boozy but not too intense.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2015 Pours a clear copper with a small creamy head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of caramel, hops and alcohol. American in nature but not abrasive like some of then american barleywines can be. Taste if caramel and toffee with a moderately high bitterness that doesnt linger for too long. Some dried leaves, tobacco. Alcohol is pretty well hidden for such a big brew. It still dries the mouth and warms a little, though. Body is medium and so is carbonation. A nice one overall, be sure to split that bottle though.

75cl bottle at home. Pours a nice clear amber colour, beige foamy head that didnt last long. Toffee sweet and tropical fruity hoppy nose. Taste is really complex with toffee and caramel malty sweetness, roasted malty tones too with coffee and chocolate, rich fruity tones with cherries, raspberries, plums and raisins, champagne notes, nice hoppy bitterness, enjoyable bourbon boozy alcoholic warmth. Lingering sweet, boozy and quite bitter finish. Medium carbonation, firm body, oily almost sticky mouthfeel. Big flavours but well balanced.

Floral hop aromas. Soft, creamy mouthfeel of caramel and toffee malt shows tons of floral nuances, dried apricot, honey and banana underneath, and a fresh hoppy backbone. Long finish. Floral style defines it. Weightless texture throughout.

bottled 5-27-14 drank 2-24-15

APPEARANCE- redish amber color, vigorously poured into a snifter yeilds 1 in of thick khaki head. good lacing stays as head dissipates

SMELL- balance of malty sweetness and bitter earthy hops. toffee scent dominates

TASTE- at first sip the hops have a bit more sway, but as the beer warms to proper temperature the sweetness prevails. as it hits the tongue you get a lot of toffee like sweetness and a bit of breadiness, when swollowing the hops hit slightly. ABV is masked well

MOUTHFEEL- thick and slightly oily, a tad bit more carbonation than expected still very slight

OVERALL- great american style barleywine, being that its a west coast beer you expect a good bit of hoppy bitterness but the malt flavor is great. Ive got one cellaring and cant wait to see how it tastes with a little bit of age

Why am I not surprised that this amazing Barleywine is from the West Coast? So many of the beers Ive loved lately are from CA or OR. This is a delicious after dinner brew, but would go nicely after work, before dinner or after lunch. If enjoyed while shoveling snow, there is no telling how much work could be done. This high Gravity, brew goes good in my tummy and I needed a boost to get through a late Feb CO Rockies snowstorm! Life is good. Proof that God Loves Us. Apologies to Ben Franklin.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2015 On tap @ Fat Angel, San Francisco - CA. Color: dark brown beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: caramel, malt, toffee. Extreme sweet flavour of caramel. Taste: oily sensation on mouth. Nice caramel and good strong vanilla aroma. Taste of alcohol. Aftertaste: nice caramel and alcohol taste.
-----
Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: dark brown beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: sweet biscuit nose. Caramel and hoppy. Very amazing balance on nose. Taste: sweet caramel and malt. Good balance of hops. Really amazing. Small vanilla finish. Aftertaste: caramel finish and wet bitterness.

Pours a hazy ruby copper color with thin soapy off-white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, and toasted malt, with hint of pine. Toffee and caramel sweetness with toasted malt and a quick noticeable hop bite at the end. Very nice beer.
Draft pour at brewery, another one iv wanted to try form them and it didnt disappoint, dark amber pour, taste of spice and herbs,great flavor.

One year old bottle. Really nice malty sweet viscous beer, with some bitterness as contrast. Some hop aroma, but mostly plum honey ready aromas.
Really good beer Barley Wine. I am curious when it is younger, with a more pronounced hop aroma, I can imagine that being a fantastic American Barley Wine.
Bottle. Pours mahogany color with a white head. Aroma and flavor of surprisingly hoppy. Has a nice and balanced taste of caramel, sweetness and hoppiness.

Keg at Brewdog Sheps Bush. Aroma is rounded sweet toffee, light berry, strawberry, caramel. Clear bright Reddy brown coloured pour with a steadfast creamy thin head. Flavour is composed of of sweet caramel and toffee, Berry, light brown sugars. Palate is sweet, velvety, moderate smooth carbonation. Really tasty.

2000 bottle. Pretty much gone at this point. Cardboardy. Will review fresher bottle. 

2011 bottle.  Pretty tasty barleywine.  Some toffee, a lot of hops.  Nice beer.

The appearance is this beautiful oak red. The aroma is bourbon/cherry. The taste right off the back is bourbon & vanilla with a pleasant bitter finish. It is a little boozy but is pleasant. Overall very good.

Keg at Brewdog, Shepherds Bush, London. A mahogany/amber coloured pour with a medium off white head on top. Rich, sweet, hoppy, caramel aroma. Tastes rich, slightly sweet, caramel, malty, dark fruit. An excellent barley wine from Alesmith Brewing Company.
750 ml bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Tiny tan head. Muddy reddish light brown body. Aroma is toffee, booze, dark fruits and liquorice. Hoppy on the tongue at first, then sweet. Warming and soothing.
Very nice copper red barleywine, complex from the nose to the taste, with caramel, dried and dark fruits, hops, dark malts. Ending burnt and bitter.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2015 A nice barleywine overall. Pours a mostly clear orange with a white head. Smells slightly of cherry and floral notes. Taste starts off a bit hoppy, but then becomes sweeter with some caramel and vanilla notes. A bit of bitterness in the aftertaste. Had on tap at Mikkeller Bar. In bottle, the beer has more Apple and wine notes, with some barley in the finish.

Bottle was a gusher on first opening--lost a good third to my kitchen counter. What was left poured a dark, reddish-brown, with big, thick, dirty white head. Aroma of licorice, booze, dark fruit. Flavor had the licorice/anise from the aroma, along with: booze, raisin, bread, malt, some hops, and more booze. This is a pretty good example of a barley wine, which isnt one of my favorite styles (but checking off the Ale Smith offerings).

Tap at BrewDog, Liverpool. Aroma has some barley and wheat. Pours brown / amber with a small white head. Taste is strong and complex with nuts, grapes and bread. Palate is thin and drinkable. Overall a good beer, one of the better Barley Wines Ive had.

Bottle @ Fermentoren, had a glass thanks to some guy in the bar, haha. Pours very cloudy muddy dark brown with a thick offwhite head. Aromas of caramel, dates, barley, some hops, slight licorice. Taste is pretty roasty and caramel malty up front, some hops and slight licorice, vanilla, dates, coffee, subtle orange peel.

On tap at Hops & Pie. Deep orange to red appearance with a white head. Aroma and flavor has malty notes of caramel and toffee nicely balanced by hoppy notes of pine, earth and fruity esters. Medium to full body. Nicely done.

Sample at semi-S&G tasting (since the music was shut down halfway through).
APPEARANCE: clear dark blond beer, no head.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity, alcohol.
TASTE: hoppy, fruity, alcohol, dry, bitter.
Flaska från Ale- house Riga. Smutsigt gyllene gult skum. Frisk mun känsla. Lite skönt spritig. Smak av portvin, smörkola och träfat. Bra balans i sötma. Lite torr efterbeska.
Flaska från Riga. Kopparfärgad med tjockt vitt skum. Tung doft av kola och bränt socker. Spritig smak med kola.
Flaska från ale house riga. Guldbrun färg med stirt gulvitt skum. Knäckig doft med barr och citrus. Kraftfull smak av malt, russin och knäck. Rejäl beska med värmande alkohol

duft: vanilje. rosin citrus. karamel. meget lidt rugbrød.
smag: karamel humle citrus. dadler

750ml bottle - pours a rusty cloudy orange with thin light brown head . Earthy hops , mild alcohol and caramel aromas . Taste - burnt sugar , toffee , earthy hops with a slightly sweet finish . Very good . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUL 21, 2015 Botella, 16/07/2015. Bottled:19/02/14 Color marron, aroma malta, caramelo, sabor dulce. Gran cerveza

bottle poured into a tulip glass..burnt orange with an off white head..aroma of booze,caramel,toffee,spices..boozy and bittersweet up front but without lingering alcohol burn..notes of caramel,spices,dark fruits..another winner from one of the best breweries around.

Rating #1036, flaske fra Kihoskh  

En teaktræsfarvet øl med luftigt skum. Duften har masser af overmodne bær og efterårsskovbund. Smagen indeholder ligeledes en del overmodne bær og frugter, der iblandt tydelig mandarin, men også ost, rosiner, vanille og grannåle. Eftersmagen er forholdvis bitter, men også ret alkoholisk - for alkoholisk, faktisk. Øllen balancerer ikke alkohol og sødme så godt som en del andre barley wines. Medium tykkelse og tyngde, med en smule for meget kulsyre til denne øltype. Alt i alt en ganske fin øl, men jeg havde forventet mere - og specielt en bedre balance - af en så velrenommeret øl.

Bottle at Kaisla, Helsinki. Pours reddish mahogany with a little head. The aroma is very intense; ripe fruits, fudge, nuts, caramel and toasty, sweet maltiness provide a rich mix. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, yet perfectly balanced as hoppy bitterness rises in the finish to a prominent level. Caramel, ripe fruits and toffee dominate but leave room for hoppier notes as well. The palate is full bodied, sticky and fairly flat. Great ale all in all.

Appearance is amber/ orangey, fairly opaque, a one finger beige bubbly head, leaves a bit of lacing. Aroma is malty, boozy, hint of chocolate malt, orange peel, fruity, biscuity, caramel, toffee, Christmas pudding hints, smells big. Taste- bitter fruits, orange peel, some raisin, hop resins, cinnamon and winter spice, peppery, caramel, some honey, lengthy finish with plenty of booze at the end, but the alcohol is quite understated for 11%. Nicely carbonated, a bit oily in the mouth. An earthy nutiness emerges as it warms. Excellent stuff.
Bottle. Clear light amber pour with an off white head. Hops and sweet caramel malt aromas. Just another hoppy barleywine. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle shared with Bug, Poet, John and Sanj. Dark amber colour with no real head to speak of. Big toffee and caramel aroma with ripe fruit notes. Strong body with dense caramel flavour, fruits, alcohol. Not that complex but delicious.

On tap at their tasting room. Pours a dark Amber with one finger of creamy off white head. Aroma is hoppy. Flavor is some citrus grapefruit lots of sweet malt and caramel. Raisins. Very sweet. Nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy copper with white head. Aroma is medicine and sweet dark fruit. Taste is raisin and candied plum.
Excellent barley wine. Sweet, but not overpowering. Well balanced and easy to drink. Top 3 barley wine for me.

Draft at Khyber Pass. Hazy medium copper pour with a slight fizzy white head. Strong, heady, fruity Barleywine. Red fruits and berries. Plums and raspberries. Figs and kiwi. Dark sour cherries. Medium caramel. Raisins and pecans. ABV is not well hidden. Huge and numbing fuzzy brew. Unabashedly harsh!
Bottle. Pours clear dark copper with off white head. Nose and taste is strong hops and grain. Dry aftertaste.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2015 Golden amber hue with a soft off-white head with ample lacing. The nose features sweet berries, some caramel malt and a hint of alcohol. This barley wine is the real deal. A nice rich texture features a solid soft roasted malt backbone, caramel richness with rich berry sweetness, rich chocolate, cherries, nuts and a slight booziness, balanced out by an orange tinged hoppiness. Is there a more balanced, complex and rich barley wine on the market? Mmmmmmmm.

Bottle, thanks to Eric. Beautiful clear amber pour with egg white head, splotchy lacing. Caramel, toffee, spicy hops on the nose. Sweet caramel and toffee start with an assertive (but well balanced) bitterness in the finish. Lasting caramel syrup finish. Alcohol noticeable. Palate: full body, sticky texture, average carbonation. Overall: Im coming to appreciate this more and more -- like, it could easily hold up as the prototype for an American barleywine. Sort of odd how time works -- 2 years ago if this was my first barleywine it would blow my mind. 10 years ago (I imagine) even if Id had a hundred barleywines I expect it would still blow my mind. But now everybody has has a chance to catch up with it -- totally a classic barleywine that is partly responsible for all the great American barleywines that have grown up emulating it, but in a blind tasting I imagine I would say "perfect example of barleywine; doesnt stretch boundaries or push the envelope; safe." Its all wibbly-wobbly, timey-wimey.
25 oct 2014, tap at Ale Smith. Dark orange/Amber. Nose is resin hops. Ned body and mildly fizzy. Train hops, red fruit, mildly lingering bitterness. Pretty good. Rich, alcohol, yet bitter.

On tap at Orenco Taphouse. Hazy dark brown pour with good head and lots of lacing. Aroma of raisins and plums and dark fruits with caramel and toasted malts. Same taste, some sweetness, little hops. Medium mouthfeel.

Aroma: alcohol, prunes, caramel and bread malts. Appearance: clear, dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: heavy grain, prunes, overripe fruit, alcohol again. Overall: nice Barley Wine, great complexity in aroma and palate. Pint at AleSmith Brewing Company, San Diego.

"similar to Old Stock but hoppier...reallt toes the line between an english and an american barleywine. i like more of the american varieties, but this is is right there with OS as one of the best of the english. Hoppier aroma than others one this list. Very strong...i wasnt near the bottle when i got my first inviting whiff. flavor was big of carmely malt first, then hops...and lots of both. mouthfeel was full, even a touch syrupy. quite good. the only knock on this beer is that the alcohol was more evident than id like. I was expecting sheer greatness, seeing as how Speedway, Wee Heavy, IPA, and the Yulesmith are all at the top of their style...this one is close, but not quite there. Very good, though...and even at $10 + s/h per bottle, Im glad i got two more. Alesmith rocks!!! ~Has gotten better over the years. Ive had enough bottles and on tap to beleive this belongs in the uppermost tier of barleywines.

750ml bottle served in a snifter glass.
A: Pours a dark amber (almost chestnut) cloudy liquid forming a medium creamy, thin bubbled beige head. Medium retention and a lot of lingering and molasses lacings left in the glass
S: Delicious combination of caramel and sweet malts. Strong notes of wood and dark fruits. Citrus hops. Notes of orange, brown sugar and nuts. A bit booze in the end
T: Sweet upfront. Strong notes of caramel malts and dark dry fruits. Notes of oak, brown sugar and orange. Citrus hops. Good bitterness kick in the end. In overall, a mild sweet beer with a light but significant bitter end. Balanced
M: Heavy, creamy and molasses body. Medium to low carbonation. Bittersweet malty aftertaste
O: Good drinkability. AleSmith quality. One of the best Barleywines Ive ever had. Very tasty but not extremely sweet. Molasses but balanced. Recommended
[ BA Review @ 2/14/2014 ]

Sept. 9, 2014. Bottle from SF. Warm reddish brown with big light brown head. Aromas of bread, sweet honey, malts, caramel. Touch of hop bitterness, ilngering but still nice. Toasted almonds, toffee flavours. Finding Im not super impressed with AleSmith beers so far.

Dark ruby/brown pour with an off white head. Aroma of dark fruit, toffee, brown sugar, a d some residual hops. Flavor is nice balance of malty sweetness with the hops peeking through in the finish. This was a 2013 bottle and it was tasty. Another year or two wouldve probably been ideal for this. Still, very respectable.

750ml bottle, 2012 vintage bought in Jan 2013. Pours deep red, totally clear, lightly sparkling, big foamy off-white head endures and leaves thin lacing. Aroma is toffee, rosewater, rhubarb tart, some orange. Body is medium, slightly foamy, rich, low carbonation. Taste is smooth malt, toffee, plum, hoppy without being astringent, slightly alcoholic but not showing all 11%. Very nice.

Fall weather is here and cracked this after not having one all summer. Forgot how good this beer is. Great color, slight head and fruity aroma. The 11% abv is hidden quite nicely in the long finish. Overall, very solid beer for the price. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle. Found no bbe on the bottle. Bought 2013. Mahogany colored, thick creamy lasting off white head. Very musty stuff, raisins, caramel, biscuits, hops, bread in aroma. Awesome. Soaked plums, hops, sweetness, malty Bready flavors. Long, long finish, layers of flavor here. Love it.

Wonderful fruity estrers. Nice earthy hops. Great balance of the two. The flavor is unreal and thick and plummy. Has a hop presence but the malts came through the most. Such a nice finish that lasted for ever. A+++

Semi hazy semi clear dark amber under a foamy light beige head. Amazing aroma of sweet plums and toast and dark stone fruits. Sweet and sticky bitter flavor of dark earthy toffee and toast, some dark stone fruit, estery alcohol notes, and bitter grassy notes and a little caramel. Really complex and tasty.

750 ML bottle

Dark amber pour, off tan head. Good body to head and great lacing to this. 
Nose is sticky sweet strawberry, caramel, dark fruits with some hop bitterness. Subtle booze.
Dark fruit jam with pine, grapefruit, and caramel taste. Low carbonation and full, yet sticky body. 
Not many straight barleywines are better than this. Sublime with age.

Bottle (750ml $12): About 6 months old. Pours brownish amber with large tan head that sticks around a while. Smells sweet, Carmel. Tastes sweet with alcohol warming. Pretty fill body. Quite a nice brew.
750ml, caramel colored pour, fuller bodied. rich toffee & caramel notes. bottle was a few years old so bitterness has subsided a tad. very well made BW

Hazy medium amber body with a small but very long-lived beige head that leaves a good amount of lacing on my tasting glass. The aroma is sweet and strong with lovely notes of caramel, dark dried fruits, brown sugar, vanilla and pungent brie. Strong flavour of caramel, grain, dark dried fruits, hints of pine and delicious DIPA-like notes of overripe tropical fruits. Quite heavy sweet taste that is kept in check by a heavy bitterness in the long-lasting finish. Superb mouthfeel, its full, syrupy, oily and with a fitting soft carbonation. Close to perfect! 
[75 cl bottle, 2013 edition, shared at home with Svensenga Smak & Behag, enjoyed 17 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy dark orange to red colour with a medium, dark beige and creamy head. Aroma of grassy hops, pine grapefruit, caramel, oak, leather and some alcohol and wild berries. Has a nice and sweet flavour with tones of caramel, brown sugar spiced with nice hoppy tones. Rich and slick mouth feel, and has a medium bitterness. A solid american BW with a good balance.

Bottle from erzbierschof.ch. Muddy brown amber with a short head. Powerful aromas of malt, fruity, toffy and alcohol. The mouth is also powerful, a little heavy, full and rich with flavors of caramel, roasted, biscuit, jammy fruits and a bitterness that is growing. Liquory and warm beer with a long finale, notes of alcohol and a bitter well present.

Butelka 75cl. 
OCZY : piwo jest przejrzyste o ślicznym kolorze z odcieniami brązu i czerwieni. Piana jest średniej wielkości i ma kolor kości słoniowej. 

NOS : zapach jest świetny ale tak intensywny, że aż zatyka. Bogate aromaty przypominają palony karmel, wiśnie, tarte, skórkę i miąższ pomarańcza, cynamon, stare porto, wanilia, winogrona Muskat, lody malaga... . 

USTA : piwo jest gęste o konsystencji tłustego mleka o wyczuwalnym i trwałym ale małym nasyceniu. 
Piwo jest słodkie i każdy jego łyk rozgrzewa alkoholem. Nuty słodowe przypominają palony karmel i nasączony alkoholem spod do tortu. Do tego skórkę pomarańczy, kandyzowana wiśnia maraschino i lody malaga. Popijemy to bardzo starym porto i mamy mniej więcej to uczucie, które towarzyszy każdemu łykowi. Na końcu piwo piecze i zostawia posmak goryczkowych ziół i słodkiego alkoholu. 

ODCZUCIA : bez zaskoczenia jest to świetne wino jęczmienne. Coś w rodzaju referencji w tym stylu. Teraz jestem bardzo ciekawy jak smakuje leżakowana w dębowych beczkach wersja tego piwa bo musi pasować jak ulał. 

OCENA : 
smak : 9/10
pijalność : 5/10
styl : +2
bready aroma, some hints of citrus. Coppar with a nice head, loads of lacing. Very delicate on the tongue, complex. Good barleywine

650ml bottle. Pours a clear copper ruby, with a large off-white head, which lasts very well and leaves good lacing. Toast, hazelnut, stewed fruits and honey are present in the aroma, along with an undercurrent of alcohol sweetness. Slight initial candied fruit notes are overcome by quite strong fruit and spice hops. These fade nicely into woody honey and hazelnut in the mid-palate, with a touch of hard toffee and stewed fruits in the finish. A very enjoyable barley wine, with plenty of class.
another overly hopped beer in a style that doesnt need to be. better barleys out there.
Had this at a fantastic tasting and had such a great time with great people and great beers!

Pours amber in color with a tan head. The aroma is of caramel, honey, toasted malts, with a bit a fruit tones. The dried fruit aromas become more present after the head begins to settle. The taste has a nice warming feeling with the fruit sweetness being evident first, then caramel and toasted flavors. This is an excellent Barley Wine.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Looks good; a transparent amberish orange with light caramel head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells solid; caramel and hops; a bit of toffee too. Sweet, but not cloying. Tastes like it smells, but more bittersweet than sweet. Medium-bodied for the style. Could be smoother, but enjoyable nonetheless.
hay, cereal, roasty, woody, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish

750ml bottle. 2013 vintage aged over a year. Thick burgundy brown-red body. Foamy off-white to beige head. Massive sweet unmistakable Barleywine aroma. Piny resinous hop covered malts. Molasses, sweet brown sugar, ever-present classic hop backbone. Exemplary example of a US Barleywine. Deep caramel brown chocolate touched malt massiveness. Yeasty and creamy. Just phenomenal.
Bomber. Garnet with a beige head. Old hops and sweet candi. Smooth, sticky and astringent.

Bottle pour at GJBF Osaka 2014. Super hoppy and caramelly nose; hops like pickaxes on the nostrils. A weathered copper color. Rich caramel initial, with alc. melting and carrying the hops right through the sinuses to the brain. Thick and very full-bodied. Suprisingly gentle, despite the flavor profile and alc level. Wow! A superb barley wine.

Pours an amber brown with a white head. Malt, caramel, toffee, toast, oak and alcohol aroma. Malt, caramel, toffee, toast, pine, alcohol, oak, and hop flavors. Full body and average carbonation. Very bitter with a caramel, oak and alcohol finish.
Color caoba con espuma color marfil. Aromas de anís, hinojo, flores y ligero caramelo. Cuerpo denso con inicio dulce de anís, algo de caramelo y final muy seco. Muy rica.

Bottle at a barley wine tasting. Pours a clear dark amber color. Nose has a lot of caramel coming off it and seems velvety smooth. Taste is similar, with some sweet caramel notes to it. Quite tasty and a great way to finish up the night.

0,75L bottle. Pours copper with off-white head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, caramel, hops, some alcohol and sourness in the background. Taste is sweet, caramel, pine, fruits, and malt. Finish is pine bitter with some alcohol burn. Overall: I really liked this one. The high rating is fully deserved.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 2013 vintage.
Hazy amber with a small beige head.
Aroma has cookie dough, fudge/toffee/caramel and figs.
Taste has cookie dough, vanilla, raisins, peppery notes, slight bourbon notes, well balanced bitterness.
Medium body, soft carbonation.
Short after taste.
Not convinced with Alesmith yet,
Barley wine, botella de 75 cl, aroma con notas a caramelo y frutas. Cerveza dulce, afrutada, compleja. Impresionante !!!1

750 ml bottle poured into a Belgian snifter. Blue foil with bottle date of 1/23/2014. Pours an amber/ruby color with a finger and a half of off-white head. Nice lacing. Aromas of caramel, toffee, dark fruit, toast, light citrus. Tastes of caramel, toffee, nutty, slight dark fruit, piney hops, resin, a little spicy kick. Medium body with a dry finish. Slick slightly syrupy mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Very nice.

This is a GREAT barley wine....I love this beer. Sweet aroma...fruits, malts and toffee. Taste is fruits, malts, toffee and pine. Need to get more of this to way down for awhile. One of my highest rated beer.

0,75L bottle. Pours copper with off-white head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, caramel, hops, some alcohol and sourness in the background. Taste is sweet, caramel, pine, fruits, and malt. Finish is pine bitter with some alcohol burn. Overall: I really liked this one. The high rating is fully deserved.

This barley wine has a beautiful brown and amber color. It has a fruity caramel aroma. It has a rich malty flavor of smokey BBQ. It finishes with a nice pleasing after taste that lingers. Very very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow! Aromat powala! Brzoskwinia, a dokładniej coś jak brzoskwiniowy mus tudzież dżem plus rześka chmielowość, cytrusy... Balans idealny!
