W smaku o dziwo nie jest słodkie, jest pełne, oblepiające, wyraźne musowanie, jest biszkopt, grejpfruty, brzoskwinia z aromatu również w silnym stężeniu. Finisz goryczkowy, długi, choć niezbyt intensywny, przyjemny. 11 procent ukryć się idealnie nie udało, ale who cares? Woltaż nie odbiera rozkoszy z picia. Genialne piwo!

Bottle shared with Simonsen
Copper hazy, big frothy beige head. Smell of caramel, dark fruitis, dark malts, hints of toast, fruity hops, zests, its all quite complex and enjoyable. Heavy sweet, fruity, alot of caramel, dark fruits, burnt caramel; alot of heavy components that are blended very well and ends up somehow balanced. Heavy bitter, alot of resins and citrus zests. All in all a fantastic barleywine. Its so smooth and the texture is super silky; simply an exquisite beer
Nose is cedar, decent alcohol, little blue cheese, some peach, feel is medium, taste is apricot, cake, red berries, later tobacco, wood notes

Shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Hazy reddish orange, beige head. Nose is malt, vanilla, fruit, bread, dates, some piney hops, oak. Flavor is tons of caramel, oak, fruity tones, bread, hops, alcohol. Vinous, full moutheel, strong, but smooth. Very nicely balanced.

2011 vintage. Pours a copper brown with two finger of fizzy eggshell foam. Lots of biscuity malts, caramel, toffee, date fruit, hoppy pine presence and aggressive carbonation. More fruit and bitterness than I predicted from the nose.

@Ölprovning på Havregatan. Flaska från craftbeer.se via Systembolaget. Arom: Karamell, sötma, humle, aprikos. Smak: Karamell, fruktig, hög sötma. Munkänslan är fyllig och krämig med en oljig konsistens. Avslutningen är alkolvärmande, något söt och har en tydlig beska.

@ Ölprovning på Havregatan. Flaska från Craftbeers Privatimport. Maltig, humlig och fruktig, hög sötma, karamell och grapefrukt, något spritig i smaken, medelfyllig till fyllig, oljig i konsistensen. Avslutningen är humlig och något söt, besk och en del alkohol. Välbalanserad.

750mL capped Champagne bottle. Bottled 01/23/14
Beautiful colour about it - a deep, clear burnished copper with a small but persistent beige head.
Really intense, complex aroma; burnt toffee, sweet biscuit, toasted nuts, woody American hops, dried grassy spice, undertones of Oloroso sherry & Sauternes, rich dessert wine dried fruits of apricot and sultana.
Excellent weight, presents its own sense of balance between being cloying & acridly dry - perfect really. Low carbonation welcomed, very long on the palate.
Body opens out with plenty of caramelised, honey malt sweetness with nutty, biscuity, toasty undertones. However, not to be outplayed, hops come through with a vengeance, not alluded to on the nose; freshly hewed pine, cooked citrus, tropical fruits, unripe melon, and a good measure of lingering grassy bitterness. Warming finish without being overtly evident. 
Top notch American barley wine; sets a high standard!

Look: Pours with huge, thick, creamy (bit of big bubbles), yellow (light mocha) head. Good, slow retention, some random sticky lacing left on the way down. Leaves a very thick, mountainy, creamy top layer. Clear, deep amber.


Smell: Oak the most dominant, bourbon. Malt driven center with molasses and caramel, medium intensity. Lightly hop driven freshness, mostly pine. Also very light alcohol notes, they get up when it warms up. Sugary and a bit salty. 


Taste: Medium-light honey, molasses start, that goes to medium sweet caramel, molasses middle and finishes with light pine bitterness with medium molasses, honey sweetness with a bit of oak. Oak and bourbon still stand strong. Lots of bitter honey sweetness stays on the lips. Nothing spikes out, everything in line - superb balance.


Mouthfeel: Full body, syrupy, bit of alcohol warming. 


Overall: Expected it to be a lot sluttier, but everything stays in good taste. Mostly amber malt and barrel driven, but the hop character is very welcome and lifts this one to a superb level.

Pours a hazy light brown color. Nose is toffee and faint pine resin. Flavor profile is predominately smooth toffee and light pine note on the finish. perfectly balanced. The mouthfeel is incredibley smooth. Fantastic stuff.

It is about time I got to this classic. Cool bottle, and a dark amber pour with a light, foamy head. The aroma is very nice, with some esters, a dash of yeast, fresh bread, dark fruit, and peach. It is super hoppy for a barley wine, and the high ABV is well masked. It is a little heavy on the tastebuds, with yeast, bitter hops, tobacco, lime, brandy, and stone fruits. A fine brew, but a little overrated imo.
Smells like a double ipa. Not asked particularly long. Taste is quite balanced with caramel slightly overpowered by hop bitterness. Smooth and full bodied. No harshness. Very good
Flaske delt med esp0r. Uklar, karamellfarget, lite karbonert. Hvit skumrand. Smaker karamell,brunt sukker, alkohol, humle, rosiner, rom. Virkelig en tungvekter dette her.

1000 ratings and this one is hard to put a handle on. Strong smell of gasoline, alcohol, and red wine. The beer is very smooth, considering it has a wealth of flavor. Grapes, wine, a bit of tart cherries, some caramel, a hint of raisin, and some breads. Very good.

750 ml bottled on 1-23-14. Aroma of caramel, sweet malt, vanilla, brown sugar, toffee, lemon rind, pine needles, floral, booze, and grass. The pour is dark reddish amber with a small head that leaves lacing. Taste is well balanced, heavy candy sweetness is offset by the generous hop influence of citrus (grapefruit and lemon) and pine. The contrast is almost a bit overwhelming. High ethanol presence. Too much like a jacked up American barley wine and not enough refinement. You have to be in the right mood for this one.

Bottle from Csak a Jó Sör. Aroma is in line with typical American barley wine. Intensely hoppy, citrusy, zesty, resiny. Complemented by caramel backbone. A bit of earthy dirt. Lightly hazy amber to red colour. Taste is again mostly hoppy. However it could use a bit more refinement, rounding the edges. Is earthy, grassy, some vegetal matter. Strong caramel, which paradoxically appears mid-way. Good, but not the top league.

750 ml bottle at home. Pours a clear, mahogany color with a small, creamy off-white head. The aroma and flavor have ample caramel and toffee, brown sugar, ripe fruity character, a splash of resin, touches of toast, some mild earthy hop character although this is malt dominant, medium bodied. This is great fresh or with age. One of the best that is readily available.

Old bottle with the 2004 onward design, light orange amber pour, white head, lots of little floaties in the glass. Aroma, still quite hoppy, brown sugar, lots of malts. Taste, thick mouthfeel, hoppy up front but it drops off quick (which might be due to the age), big malty finish, with zero hint from the ABV. Another stellar beer from these guys.

Flaska från Brill. Drucken med ölföreningen. Smak och doft av ljunghonung, vanilj, läder, söt tobak, russin, plommon, mogna äpplen, bourbon, grand marnier. Fruktig, rund och oljig med en markerad beska. Mycket gott.
Med ölföreningen 2014. Smak och doft av honung, vanilj, läder, tobak, russin och plommon. Fruktig, rund och oljig med tyldig, lite stickig beska. Mycket gott.

Bottle from exactly a year ago 3/28/13. Copper amber color. Aroma of toffee, caramel, roasted barley, a hint of booze, and dark fruit. The taste follows suit and adds a spicy hop bite, sweet malts, and dark fruit. The mouthfeel is perfect with a balanced booze element. Wow!! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Kvelden topper seg her på Cardinal med denne, kveldens nest siste (mars-14): so sweet, so fulfilling, so nice. Nydelig aroma og stor smaksfylde. En bauta og markør i barleywine-stilen.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2016 Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 24.03.14 and 23.05.16.Ruby orange with small off-white head. Sweetish aroma and taste of American hops, bittersweet orange marmelade and sawdust. Some chocolate. Round and bitter mouthfeel. Complex.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2016 Bottle at Cardinal, 2014/03/24. Bitter and sweet with some fruit and raisin. Well balanced. Nice reddish amber colour. Tastes "darker" than it looks.

Re-rated 20160523: Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy dark amber with off-white head. Aroma of caramel, raisins, some acetone, chocolate, some vinous notes, ethanol. Tastes bitter and sweet, like bitter medicine. Somewhat unbalanced.

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Pours a misty orange body with a creamy light brown head leaving good lacing. Malts, caramel and tropical fruits with pollen on the nose. Salty malty alcoholic potion with a mellow botterness. Full bodied and smooth.

The lack of carbonation and head on this works perfectly towards the appearance, which ends up looking like brandy in the glass. Aroma is complex with caramel, tart fruit, pine, floral, and grass. Taste is sweet at first, before getting more aggressively bitter. Very nice. One of the best barleywines Ive had yet.

Pour from 22oz bomber. Pours a robust amber hue with a thick white head that really lasts. Aroma is stupendous! Lots of caramel, malt and molasses aroma. Taste is sweet and smooth. Caramel, soft roasted malts, sugar and a hint of hops. Palate is buttery and the mouthfeel is awesome. You can taste some of the ABV coming through, but not as bad as some barleywines can be. I usually have a love/hate relationship with barleywines, but this one is at or near the top. So well balanced!

750 ml bottle. Pours clear ruby amber with a big creamy off white head that retains well and laces the glass.

The aroma is toasted toffee malt, some sugary fruit and strong alcohol.

The flavor is sweet toffee malts with some fruit and a harsh ashy alcohol finish. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with low carbonation.

Overall, OK barleywine, but too much over the top alcohol.

2010 bottle. Amazing aroma - and the taste is just as good. Very nicely done with fermenting this out, minimal syrup for a 11% barley wine. Sweetness is kept in check and well balanced with the hops. Striking dark cherry color when held to the light. I let this one sit, and forgot about it, well blowing by their age for up to 24 months guideline, but I think it worked out. Serious (though still super loose) sediment layer on the bottom of the bottle AlesSmith delivers, again!
Red in color with an inch of poofy white head. Aroma of sweet toffee and fruitcake. Taste is the same, and rich, with strong bittering and mellow tangerines notes. $11/750
Red/brown with a large, fluffy, off white top. Aroma is toasty, caramel and fruits. Taste is hoppy, toasted, some spice.

Another beer I managed to get my hands on and have a decent sized sample of during the Belgian Beer Board website Pre-Brugge Beer Festival bottle swap on 31st Jan 2014. Thank you whoever brought it.

My second ever Alesmith, I hope to meet some more one day.

Misty reddy brown with a light beige topping.

Dark fruits and caramel hit the nose initially, then more subtle notes arrive: light citrus hints and yeast esters mingle with the stronger said fruits and caramel malty molasses.

The taste is very similar to what your nose has told you: semi-sweet caramel, dark fruits with an underlying yeastiness with a citrus trace or two. Most enjoyable.

Rich and deep body with the alcohol just about kept in check.

Overall a very good brew and one Id happily have again: maybe a bottle to myself next time.
Bottle - Vintage 2004 - Raisin, dark sugar and booze. Cloudy orange with a rich white head. Hop oil, raisin, brown sugar and booze. Nice and still potent after 10 years.
750 ml bottle pours hazy brown with a off white head. Aroma of fruit, malts and toffee. Taste is sweet malts, toffee and sweet fruit.

750ml bottle: Didnt realize I had this for so long. 2003 bottle drank in Feb 2014. This one pours a dark caramel color. There was about no head on mine, nor was there any lacing. The aroma is very nice. Faint citrus hops, along with some caramel malts. No sweetness to speak of. Possible some honey and raisins in there, as well as some toffee and biscuit. The taste is excellent. A slight sweetness, as well as a definite silky texture. Some caramel, raisin, toffee. There is a lot going on here. Actually a faint dryness to the finish. A wonderful offering.

Amazing barley wine. It smells like a perfect barley wine, sweet but challenging. The first sip shows its bitter character, dancing with the malty sweetness. It leaves your mouth tingling. It is slightly boozy, but for 11 percent, remarkably easy as well. This is balance. Tastes: red fruits, flowers, pepper, sweet malts.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)
This is a pretty good barley wine. Really nothing outstanding about it and I'll probably never buy it again, but it was pretty good.

Deep reddish mahogany brown in color... Aroma of light citrus hops, caramel malts, dark fruits... Flavor is citrus hops, caramel malts, thinnish body for a barleywine... Dry and hoppy finish... Interesting take on a barleywine, but prefer them maltier and richer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A: Dark amber, small head, yellowish. S: Lots of dark fruit, caramel malt. T: Liquorice, some sweetness, bitter roast, alcohol warmth. M: Very smooth. O: Very deep.
Bottle. Copper colour with white head. Strong yeast aroma. Sweet, malt, caramel taste, with some fruitness. Full body.

750 ml, bottled. Pours slightly cloudy red with nice beige head. Aroma: Lots of hops, pine, apples. Malty background. Chocolate. Balanced. Taste: Medium sweet, malty flavours. Minimal hints of acidity. Hops afterwards. Palate: Medium-full body, dry. Long hoppy aftertaste with malty background. Very nice.
Pours a hazy amber. Has a malt, prune, and carmel aroma. A very sweet barelywine flavor with some dark fruits and sweet malt. A smooth, but still dark alcohol, aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours an opaque toffee-amber with a good sized cream head. Aroma is caramel, lots of honey, stone fruits, a little citrus. Taste is medium sweet, with a decent hop presence, and a good amount of alcohol as well. Finish is quite alcoholic. Medium bodied for what it is. Good, but too much alcohol.
Bottle. Wonderful toffee raisin aroma. Taste is the same, with slight vegetable notes, and bitter. Sticky full body.

Big bottle. Dark amber color with beige head. Aroma of bubble gum, fruits, sweet malt, caramel, mango, honey and hops. Taste is sweet and malty, lots of caramel, honey, nice hops, fruity, citrus, sugary, mango. Sweet and complex, nice BW!

Bottle shared with cards04. Auburn colour. Really hoppy aroma for a barley wine. This was more leaning towards the double IPA than a barley wine although it had some booze heat. Resinous, hoppy, a bit of that barley wine sweetness but not as much as others. Unique and interesting.

Bottle shared with cards04. Auburn colour. Really hoppy aroma for a barley wine. This was more leaning towards the double IPA than a barley wine although it had some booze heat. Resinous, hoppy, a bit of that barley wine sweetness but not as much as others. Unique and interesting.

Refrigerated 75 cl bottle with silver foil poured into a snifter. Pours translucent amber with small off-white head. Aroma is big caramel with balancing herbal hops, medium body, low carbonation, and little small bubble lacing. Taste is caramel, some booze, and herbal hop finish. Not bad, but still not one of my favorite styles.

18/I/14 - 75cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ RBBWG III, my place - BB: n/a (2014-90) Thanks to JefVerstraete for sharing the bottle!
Clear red amber beer, irregular beige small head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: bubble gum, pretty hoppy, exotic fruits, mango, bit sweet, honey, sugary touch, caramel. MF: ok carbon, full body. Taste: sweet start, malty, caramel, honey, nice hops, fruity, citrus, sugary, some passion fruits, mango. Nice complex and very fruity barley wine!
@RBBWG 2014. Hazy amber colour, a lot of beige foam. Low carbonation. Very intense hoppy charakter. Fruity aroma (citrus). Some sweetness. Very well balanced.

Sampled @ RBBWG 2014. Thanks to JefVerstraete! Pours an orangish brown with a small tan had. The smell is caramel, citrus, alcohol, fruit. The taste hot alcohol, caramel, rich fruit ending dry and spicy. The body is full with nice very elegant carbonation.

2012 Vintage. 75 cl. bottle sampled @ RBBWG 2014. Courtesy of & thx! to JefVerstraete. Touch murky fox amber with little head. Nose is surprisingly hoppy, lots of hops, flowers, bitter with some caramel & brown sugar in the background. Nose is very hop bitter upfront, flowers, bitter herbs, touch grass, thick caramel malts in the back, sweeter backbone, touch nuts. Touch higher carb. Too much hops for me, not bad but not really my thing. Im not into hoppy barley wines, I dont get the concept, I do suppose they survive better that way. I would have probably liked it more, had it been aged a couple of years in order to get rind of the hops. I am still not a AleSmith fanboy unlike everyone else it seems.

Nose is malt dominant with hints of yeastyness buried deeper is some darker earthy hops. Palate is adequate. Malts dominate the flavor without causing a syrup or sugary note. Mid palate the hops jump up to say hello but are quickly washed away by some subtle dried fruits. 

---That dog will hunt!

Bottle. Cloudy copper, some head. Delicious raisins, chocolate and marcipane aroma. More marcipane in the mouth, followed by dark fruit and chocolate. Sweet and rich, but a bit hard on the tongue. Enjoyable.

Good. While not my favorite style, this one is better than most. Importantly, not a huge booze bomb in flavor, despite the ABV. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at RBWG14 
Smell is very sweet grainy . Some sugar 
Taste is bit bitter, sweet, malty and grainy . Touch of booze . 
Carbonation is perfect . 
Nice one !
Aroma is light fruit, caramel, nuttiness and dry earthiness. The flavor is malts, strong caramel, fruit and nutty/slightly funky fruit finish.

Brownish ruby color with an off white foam that last throughout. Aroma is sweet malt, caramel and dark fruits. Taste is very well balanced. Lots of malt, a little coffee in the finish, dark fruit, molasses and caramel. Excellent beer!

Pours reddish-brown with a thick, foamy, tan head that dissipates to a film within a minute or two. Looks brown in the glass, but held up to the light its red, like a ruby. Beautiful beer! 
Nose is a divine smorgasbord of sensations: dried fruits, honey, some nice booze notes. Predominately sweet on the tongue with a nice bitter touch on the back of the palate. Caramel notes come through while sipping. Fairly full-bodied brew with a creamy texture, soft carbonation, slightly bitter finish. Delicious!
Expected more from this. Dark red / brown colour, cloudy pour, slight white head. Aroma is very sweet, hops, malt, booze and caramel. Rather thick bodied, kind of reminiscent of old engine oil.

750 mL bottle. Dark reddish brown cloudy pour with a thin off white head. Aroma of burned sugar, hops, alcohol and caramel. Thick bodied, a beer you can almost chew with a lasting bitter hoppy finish.

2013 bottle. Poured a caramel, dark brown color with a tan head. Aroma was sweet malts, barley wine grains, alcohol booze. Caramel, candi, with a touch of wood and a dab of citrus. Flavor was boozy, sweet malts, grain, caramel, citrus. Boozy. Pretty easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours hazy deep golden/copper with a nice stable and creamy off-white head. Aroma is strong hoppy, resiny and spicy underneath an earthy sweet malty body. Strong grainy malty taste, rich and powerful resiny hops, full bodied, light alcohol burn lingering together with resiny hops. Nice and complex.

Bottle, 2012 version. Pours red/amber with a white medium sized white head. Aroma has mainly dried fruits with a touch of hops, figs, raisins, caramel, resin, pine, honey and slight alcohol. Taste is sweet dried fruits and caramel up front, piney bitter mid through and a medium dry pine bitterness in the finish with a touch of alcohol warmth. Smooth body with a light sticky sweetness, average carbonation.

Pours a beautiful nut brown color, with a creamy off white head. Excellent lacing. Extremely light aroma of root beer. Excellent creamy palate. A fine session beer (high ABV!). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11% 3250 yen bottle from Tanakaya, shared with David. A beautiful honey amber with a thin beige head. Barleywine aroma, caramel, toffee & hops. Smooth, silky, creamy mouthfeel, malty sweet caramel with some pine/citrus hop notes. Decent but not worth that high price.

From tap at the brewery. Pours clear and golden orange to brown with a lacing off-white head. Caramel and and hoppy and dense hoppy aroma. Flavour is smooth and dense hoppy and medium sweet caramel malty flavour. Fruity hops and mild spiced finish. Lovely.

Stored for a year in my cellar. Pours a medium dark amber with a fairly low yet tight white head. Aroma is lovely: caramel, raisins, figs, dates, lots of honey, candied peaches and apricots, hay, maple syrup. Taste is equally good - lots of honey again, caramel, roasted raisins, figs, dates, candied fruit, hay, maple syrup. Mouthfeel is full-bodied and somewhat sticky. Aftertaste is slightly boozy with caramel, peach and honey that lingers for quite a while. Very very good, if not as good as the BA version.

This review with my brother and dad. Pours a nice copper color with nice beige head and lacing. Very nice aroma of caramel and very floral. Really nice aroma! Tastes brilliant! 11% doesnt taste like it. Very well balanced with bitter orange flavor hide the etoh, nice malty back bone makes it a true barley wine. Love it.

Bottled 11/05/13. Big hop flavors dominate with undertones of sweet and salty caramels. Deep down alcohol remnants linger nicely. Very hard to pin down. Perhaps the definitive San Diego / West Coast IPA version of barleywine?

0.75l bottle. A bit hazy dark orange body, light brown head. The aroma is mostly citrusy hoppy, but it also has some caramel and a hint of toastyness to it. The taste is more complex. It has lots of caramel and citrusy hops with toast and roasted malts. Its very sweet, but it also has a nice bitterness. Medium/full bodied with an oily texture. Awesome beer.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2014 shared bottle. poured a light orange colour with a big light tan head. sugar, maple syrup, caramel, toffee, orange, dark fruits, citrus, balanced bitterness, pines, alcohol is verry well hidden! never was a fan of barley wines. but this was so good!

FROM NOTES: October 31, 13. From a From a750 ml. bottle into a Spiegelau tulip. 

A: WOW! Bready, spicy, and bold with the alcohol. Subdued anise-type spices, strong pine notes and some citrus hop notes.
A: Maple brown body with a nice yellowed paper head. Nice retention and great lace.
T: I would call the taste "strong" as it carries big hops and big malts that balance out in this very rich caramel and toffee sweetness with a substantial alcohol burn.
P: Full body and medium carbonation.
O: Overall a good representation of the style, though the hops are a bit strong for my tastes.
Amber colour. Hoppy caramel aroma. Taste is sweet, caramel, figs, finishes with a nice bitterness.

750ml bottle into a tulip glass; served cold.

Aroma: Bitter hops with citrus notes. Some vanilla too.

Appearance: Translucent blood red body with massive french vanilla ice cream colored-head. Very nice lacing.

Taste: Kind of a warm malt base with a bitter hop finish. A little bit of vanilla for sure. Complicated but nicely balanced.

Palate: Medium-full body, very low carbonation. Long malty finish.

Overall: Interesting! A nice barleywine, nice bitter hop twist. Really good!
Very interesting beer. Lots of strong aromas and flavors, on the bitter side...seems like an IPA with a huge malt presence. Very nice barley wine beer.

Dominating malts with intense citrus hop character. Vinous. Caramel, surprisingly fruity, licorice, oak, raisins, bit warming finish. Aroma/flavour bomb. Sweet with quite intense bitterness. Again. .awesome brew from alesmith. Its like perfect balance MIX of IMP/Scotch ale/IIPA. Fancy, highly enjoyable
Sour cherry, sweet and complex. Aroma is hoppy, sweat and salty, thou taste is so rich and stunning. Should be served chilled. Impressive and must have

Bottle. Heavy malt aromas of cookie and caramel, moderate cooked orange for the hops, dough for the yeast, with background notes of date, brown sugar, nutmeg and alcohol. Head is small, wispy, light beige with no lacing but good legs and is almost fully diminishing. Color is muddy medium brown. Flavor starts moderately sweet and acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is medium to full, close to syrupy with a carbonation between soft and lively and finishes lightly astringent. All the well rounded aromas and flavors of a high quality American Barley Wine.

Wow as soon as I popped this I could smell the caramel. Pours a dark amber with a nice retained head. Full of sweetness on the nose but the you get the hoppy finish which gives you the impression of a double ipa. Very nice beer.
Pours dark golden brown with aroma of honey fruit and malt. Sweet malt followed by a citric bitterness. Full body with medium carbonation. Solid barley wine. Old foghorn is still my favorite.

Bottle, shared with my in laws. I cant believe I havent tried this epic beast yet! Beautiful golden amber with a golden crown. Sponge toffee, bread crusts, chewy malts, citrus hops, gloriously dense and rich and warming-- everything I love in a BW!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
2012

Pours orange, finger off white head.

Smell fruity fig, raisins, very english, toffee

Taste strong toffee, caramel, bit hoppy still, burn on tail

Medium body

Decent

Bottle. Pours mostly clear amber/copper with thick frothy beige head. Aroma is cookie and cereal malts, dates, spicy and floral hops, and plums. Flavor is bready malt base, some floral hop and grapefruit bitterness, some dark fruit sweetness, and light alcohol spice; dry finish. Medium body and low carbonation.

From a bog bottle. Pours hazy copper with a frothy off white head and lots of lacing. Tastes sweet, smooth, very nutty, malty, and like raisins and alcohol. Low/medium body and low carbonation. Smells sweet, malty, and like dark dried fruits.
Bottle. Pours amber with a nice bit of off white head. Aroma of booze and oak. Taste of heavy booze and dark fruit.
Brown body with an off white head. Good lacing. Aroma is plums, raisins. Taste is fruity. Some alcohol. Mild carbonation.

Thanks to someone in my many BIFS who sent this to me a couple of years ago. Pours an almost still dirty brown. Aroma is intense alcohol, raisins and purple fruits. Taste still has a big alcohol burn but smooths out with raisins and an almost winelike fruityness. Still some small hops that provide a touch of bitterness. Syrupy and resinous as it sits on the palate. Definitely a sipper, take it slow.
On tap, pours brown with low head, aroma is sweet malt, taste is pretty mild compared to all the other beers

Det här var en god öl, kanske till och med riktigt god, men jag hade ändå väntat mig något mer och särför blev jag också lite besviken. Ölen hade en kraftfull smak med toner av grapefrukt, russin och choklad, kroppen var tokstabil och balansen fanns på plats men övertygade inte.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2013 Pours an orange/ruby with a one finger, off-white head that thins to a film. Nice lacing.Aroma has big notes of tropical fruits, alcohol, slight bread, and caramel.Taste is a balanced malty/bitter with a touch of fruity malt with a solild bitter aftertaste. Medium body with a low-medium carbonation. Slightly slick and syrupy with a solid amount of bubbles.Overall very nice. Solid aroma, taste, and texture.
Hazy orange body, white head. Aroma has cookie dough, huge resiny hoppiness, caramel and sweet malt. Flavour is really malty, some dark rich candy and some sweet fruits. Bit alcohol.

Great barley wine, copper-coloured and faint hazy. Has a lasting head. Heavy malty aroma, pure, with faint alcohol. Flavor starts heavy sweet and malty, long lasting. Faint citrus notes. Finish light bitter. Syrupy texture. Soft carbonation.
Bottled. A clear red pour with a light tan head. The aroma is very fruity and sweet. The taste is very strong, hops and malt; with light notes of fruit. Overall a very strong barley wine.

Láhev 750 ml. Aroma je příjemné znát po ořechovici s náznakem praeného sladu a karamelu. Pěna je lehce nahnědlé barvy, vysoká, jemná a středně drící. Barva samotného piva je temná měděná. Chuť je velmi robustní, je silně znát po alkoholu, praeném sladu a karamelu v celkové chuti je také znát exotické ovoce,fini má opravdu silný nádech alkoholu. Toto pivo spíe připomíná luxusní alkohol neli pivo, ale svojí chutí a aroma je velmi zajímavé a unikátní.

Pours a deep burnt orange colour with thin light beige head that sticks around for the show. The aroma is caramel, vanilla, dates, raw sugar, alcohol, some nuts, bit of pine as an after thought. The flavour follows suit, big on the sweet caramel and vanilla notes, light notes of dates, and a slight nuttiness, vanilla shows up again in the finish which trails off into a delicious complexity. Very awesome!
fruity caramel and some subtle toasty notes on the nose. smooth tasting caramel the whole way through. slightly sticky on the palate. clean finish. great beer and very drinkable, but not too complex.

9.4 Fl. Oz. Bottle. 
Pours clear amber with tan head. 
Aroma caramel, white chocolate, vanilla, sweet, dark fruits. 
Taste creamy caramel sweet, hopy bitters, warming alcohol, little sour finish. 
Mouth-feel very creamy, sticky, dry finish. 
Amazing beer, beautiful creamy texture, complex taste, and an amazing nose.

Bottle: cloudy amber pour with a large tan head. Aroma is caramel, vanilla, and a very light citrus. Flavor is thick caramel, bread, orange zest, and a small bit of vanilla and honey. Palate is rather syrupy thick, but not overly sweet or boozy. This is a filling beer but much too easy to drink, Ill have to get more.

750 ml bottle. From bierkompass.de. HHOK XV.
Murky brown colour. 
Malt, resiny hops and caramel sweetness in the aroma.
Malt, very strong hops, bitterness and mild sourness in a strong aroma. 
Tasty.
Awesome barleywine on tap at the brewery, super rich with lots of caramel, sweet, strong, kickin

Bottle @ unibaren Aarhus. Slightly clouded dark amber, big tan head that settles quickly, good lacing. Aroma, malty, toffee, caramel, boozy, vanilla, hop notes, dark fruits. Taste, malty, toffee, caramel, dark fruits, vanilla, bread, wood, boozy. Smooth. Boozy malty aftertaste.
Bottle courtesy of mrsquash2....pours a clear, dark amber color with tan head. Caramel malt and dark fruit aroma. Much of the same in the flavor. Very tasty and smooth, alcohol well hidden.

Bottle thanks to mrsquash2. Nose full if sweet malt and dark fruit. Full of chewy malt. Thick and yummy. Subtle alcohol warming. Grate. 

---Rated via intercellular device
280913: Copper barlywine with a fine foam. Light caramel and dark fruit taste. However, I was a little disappointed with this beer that I had really been looking forward to with a RB rating on 100.

Brilliant color.. Very unfiltered brown caramel color with a dark cream colored head. The smell is slightly alcoholic & malty. Definitely blended perfectly between the malts/hoppyness/alcohol. Carmel notes, molasses & brown sugar taste. Slight hints of bruised cherry & under-ripe pear. Well aged.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle sampled at a tasting. From notes. Boozy with a decent bit of smoke, dark fermented fruit and vanilla with caramel. Very good.

Blue foil cap cover, blue "Anvil" logo , 2011 vintage??>
Clean off-white head, medium to high lacing and medium head retention.
Very Nice mouthfeel, typical barley wine esters at high%s, yet smooth going down, another easy drinking high alc! - caution :)

750ml bottle poured into a tulip glass. Appearance is a nice murky brown/black with low carbonation. Sweet aroma with massive toffee notes. Taste is a mouthful of burnt caramel toffee with a lingering bitterness in the aftertaste. A bit unbalanced to me but not my favorite style either.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drank from a bottle at a friends. A very good barleywine with a sweet but sharp taste. Theres some malts in the taste in addition to hops.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2014 750ml bottle that I purchased in January 2012. Shared with friends. Mostly clear dark red color. Fine particles visible in the body. Thin khaki head. Dots and ropes of lace. Bigger body. Smooth, lighter carbonation. Kind of a creamy mouthfeel. Caramel malts, good spicy hop, some nuttiness, hint of spice, good complex malt bill, and a good hop still showing nicely in this aged example. Moderate bitter taste, more sweet. Some warmth in the finish. Nice, complex, smooth barleywine to sip on. 7/4/7/4/15 Re-rate on tap 7/25/14: From a keg filled May 27, presumably from this year. Tastes very fresh and hoppy. Pours a mostly clear red orange color. Thin khaki / off-white head, leaves decent bits of lace. Very nice bigger tropical fruity hop aroma, some citrus. Light caramel malt, some spicy toastiness. Awesome bigger bitter taste, hopped up kind of like a DIPA. Kind of zesty citrusy, light to moderate sweet, and a nice light bit of alcohol warmth. Fantastic hoppy barley wine. Significantly better fresh and on tap than the vintage bottle I originally rated.
Orange with an off-white head. Aroma is honey, candied orange peel, marmalade. Slightly bitter on the palate. Taste is honey, pine, citrus peel.

Thick, close to amber color with a large light tanned head. Aroma is caramel, malts with a slightly spiced, grassy tone. Resin and pine. Taste is rich malty with a resinous bitterness. Dark fruits and toffee. Pine and a well balanced finish. Body is close to oily with soft to medium carbonation.

750ml bottle from Downer Wine and Spirits. Pours a deep, reddish brown color with a huge tan head that leave some nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is malty, fruity, raisin, currant, nutty. Medium to heavy on the palate with soft creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, nutty, caramel, light smoke, a little booze, with a sweet, malty finish. Very tasty.

Deep red-brown with intrusive tan head. Aroma brown sugary malt, toasty dark bread, dark fruits. Full body, alcohol is there for sure, a little oily mouthfeel. Flavor sweet butterscotch and caramel malts, a little coffee maybe, but somehow its all a bit thin and controlled by the alcohol. I love a good strong barleywine but this just didnt work well for me. All the other reviews are so favorable, makes me wonder if I didnt get a good bottle.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2014 dark amber/ruby colour, 1-2 cm yellowish creamy head, which lasts for minutes, which is surprisingly long in the light of the style and high ABV; extremely complex aroma of caramel, figs, honey, pine resin, floral-grassy hops and minimal liqueur; taste is also far from being simple: sweet and bitter in parallel - honey, herbal liqueur, pine resin, hoppy bitterness with slight citrusy notes, caramel...and cool bitter aftertaste; definitely the best barley wine I have ever tasted, and one of the best beers, too; I love it! Its just incredibly complex and amazing.

Appearance: Clear ruby/brown with a 2 finger thick creamy ivory head.
Aroma: Dried figs, prunes, raisins, citrus, subtle marmalade note, vinous verging on brandy or whisky undertones, pine, floral, toast, peat, a hint of woodiness and toffee.
Taste: Medium sweetness, bitterness and sourness. Slight saltiness.
Palate: Rough thick texture, light/medium body, prickly carbonation and astringent. The finish lingers with alcohol warmth, dried fruit, a slight chocolate flavour, vinous notes with an initial sour and sweetness which develops into bitterness.
Comments: Very good and nice glass lacing.

Bottle, pours amber with small to medium head. Notes of raisin, fig, nuts, and malt. Carbonation is pretty soft with a layered body. Finishes slightly bitter from I guess the hops with a lingering finish, Excellent balance. Not my favorite style at the moment but impressive if the booze doesnt bother you.
Wonderful barley wine. Occasionally with a sweet taste. The only question is whether it fits into the crayfish Ill eat. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Bottle from Total Wine consumed at E-Ne-Nuk, aged twenty months. Love AleSmith!

Bottle from Dodgrblu at Klamath. Aroma is caramel, bubble gum, caramelized onion, and brown sugar. Flavor is much of the same and keeps a nice carbonation to it. Very good beer. Will have again!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Copper with some red here and there and smallish head. Powerful hop flavors, grape, pines and some ripe fruits. Bitter taste. Some salty licorice at first and then turning into explosion of hops. Full and strong beer with excellent hop flavors. Definitely worth the money.

Pours a deep dark amber colour, murky with a frothy/creamy tan head. Aroma is heavy in caramel and toffee with a little candied sugar and floral hop scents too. Taste is sweet for the most part but is book ended by strong bitter kicks. Full bodied, creamy mouth feel, and lively carbonation. Overall an exceptional ale and really great barleywine.

.75l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours clear amber with medium tan head. Aroma is nuts, dark fruits, malts, alcohol and raisin. Flavor is alcohol, malts, fruits, raisin and nuts. Some caramel. Swell!

1 pt 9.4 fl oz (750ml) bottle. Clear bright coppery amber colour, foamy biege head that retains and aroma of caramel, orange, pine fruity hop. Taste is sweet malt caramel with floral orange, nutty woody pine and a spicey hop bitterness. Oily mouth feel, medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, warming dry lingering bitter finish. Nicely balanced and very drinkable.

Amber, copper beer with a foamy beige head. Huge caramel and sweet, orange fruits on the nose. Full body. Soft and smooth. A hint of carbonation. Caramel sweetness fills your mouth. Some sourness and alcohol warmth. Medium bitterness. Quite a balanced and solid barley wine. Very, very good.

Oh boy. A big, swagger filled barleywine. It hits you with the caramel malts, the bitter hops that lurk in the background (it never feels hoppy) to keep everything in check. It's a great BW, mainly because it clocks in at 11% but never feels so. It's strong and tasty. A barleywine on turbo. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, Brew Dog Shop. Good lookin dark amber pour with a restrained off white-head. Sweet malts and fruits in the nose, alongside some hoppage and wood notes. Cracking balance in the flavour. Rich and creamy mouthfeel with the booze skillfully smothered. Slipped down an absolute treat and drank nowhere near its strength. Stonking stuff.

Beautiful ruby reddish amber. Large creamy off-white head, lasting with lace. Aroma is bursting with smooth balanced hops and malt. Caramel, citrus, grapefruit. Flavor much the same. Smooth bitterness. Amazingly balanced. So smooth. Medium to full body. Soft and creamy, partly oily, alcohol never gets beyond the shadows. Smooth bitterness. Roasty, semi-sweet, with lingering bitterness on the finish. Just about perfect. Very impressive, I really enjoyed this.

aroma-fruit, malty, a little caramel. 
Very strong, bold, smooth flavor. Roasty, slight alcohol, finish. Malt, caramel, a little fruity-grapefruit. Similar to the aroma but bolder.
Bottle. Pour is oddly clear copper with off-white head. Hops shine through on the nose, lots of caramel malts, dark fruits. Really solid pine, nice lacing. Well-balanced, slightly boozy.

Bottle shared by The Hoff - thanks! Hazy orangish amber pour with a white head and white lacing. Hoppy and malty nose. Nice balance in the taste - a fun barley wine. Would love to try the barrel aged version.

0.75l bottle as a birthday gift from my lovely girlfriend bought at Cask Beer Co.. London. The first thing i notice on the pour is a lively deep amber almost warming red body, light cloudy and it has a big really lacing light beige top. Looks and smells fantastic with lots of malty fruity sweetness mixed with lots of nuts and some spicy caramel. Im actually having this for dessert after a fantastic surf N turf meal. Rich thick oily on the mouthfeel and the carbonation level is soft and prickling on the tongue. It has those sweet sticky nuts and some spices in the taste. Its sweet, but still balanced in a lovely way. Lots of malty caramel sweetness, some traces of both gunpowder and dried wild strawberries. A lovely thing. The alcohol is hardly noticeable at all, and thats a bit scary. Really enjoyed this! 06.07.2013

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 200713.
Brown with beige head. Aroma of alcohol and malt. Flavour with caramel and fruit.

Pours caramel brown w 1 finger off white head. Smells malty and hops. Taste of hops and malts. Medium carbonation and long bitter.

Taste improves with air.


---Rated via Beer Buddy

750 ml. bottle. Pours a cloudy brownish amber with a small white head. Aroma of caramel, fruit, pine, and florals. Taste is caramel malt, grapefruit, lemon, pine, dark fruits, florals, and a touch of alcohol. Very, very good!!
I was really excited to try this one. Smells malt, charamel, brown sugar. Sweet mouthfeel With sticky charamel aftertaste. Overall: Boring, was expecting much more from this one.

On draft at Hamiltons Tavern. I had wanted to taste this and had my chance today. Delicious english style barleywine though I think hyped as American. Sweet, not as hoppy of a profile as American barleywines. A delicious treat for barleywine lovers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gotta say I wasn't expecting it to be this good. Sweet, decadent malt dominates the aroma and palate. Far superior to the multitude of barleywines we just finished. Dangerously smooth; I could drink too much of this before knowing what hit me.
Has a very sweet aroma as expected. Has a hint of citrus and a little bit of a stout taste. Tastes like its missing something, I feel like I may have gotten a bad batch. Very drinkable though.
Bottle shared with friends. Another that Im glad I finally got to try but its just not my cup of tea. Too much malt and sort of hard to drink in the FL heat.

[US West Coast Trip 2013] Tap @ Alesmith Brewing Co. San Diego. Ja det här var så bra så jag började nästan gråta. Aroman var himmelsk, färsk, lite fruktig, jäst och lite karamell. Smaken och kroppen är så välbalanserad till 124,57%

75 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear amber with an off-white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma is caramel, dried fruit, and hops. Flavour is caramel, dried fruit, and some warming alcohol  with a bitter finish.

2012 bottle pours mahogany brown with a tan head thats leaves a thick sticky coat of lacing. Nose of pitted fruit, caramel, and toffee. Same in the mouth wrapped in a chewy and grainy body. Freakin sweet.

Dark brown pour with a small tan head. Strong yet sweet aroma of licorice, caramel, sigarettes, barn, citrus and a strong hoppy character. Loads of caramel malts. Taste is heavy on the sweet side and medium bitter. Full bodied.
Everything you need in a bareleywine, thick caramel malts, slight spice, hint of hoppy bitterness.
Pours amber with off white head. Smell of citrus, toffee. Taste is a mixutre of citirs and vanilla/toffee malt with a nice hop tough. Very true to form and all around solid.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2015 Red brown. Aroma is hops. Taste is fantastic for this American style barleywine - caramel butterscotch. Lovely. Palat is a clean finish without the classic stickiness. My favourite hoppy barleywine.

750 ml bottle into snifter; no bottle dating, but was purchased in late 2011.  Pours hazy deep ruby red color with a small dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lasts.  Light soapy lacing clings on the glass.  Aromas of big caramel, raisin, apple, orange zest, floral, brown sugar, pine, molasses, toast, orange rind, brown bread, and floral earthiness.  Damn nice aromas good balance and complexity of dark malt and fruity/earthy hop notes; with good strength.  Taste of big caramel, toffee, orange zest, apple, toast, floral, pine, orange rind, brown sugar, brown bread, chocolate, light roast, and floral earthiness.  Fair amount of floral/pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, toffee, orange zest, orange rind, light fruits, toast, light chocolate, brown bread, brown sugar, floral, pine, light roast, and floral earthiness on the finish for a while.  Fantastic balance and complexity of deep malt and hop flavors; with a nice bitterness/sweetness balance, and hardly any cloying flavors after the finish.  Medium carbonation and very full bodied with a creamy, slick, and fairly sticky mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a fantastic well aged barleywine.  Fantastic complexity and balance of deep malt and hop flavors; and very smooth to sip on.  A highly enjoyable offering.
Solid ass barleywine.  Hits all the right now.  Hard candy spicy notes.  Teue to the style and awesome.

Cloudy caramel brown pour with a 2 finger, creamy khaki head that has great retention. Aroma is hug on toffee and caramel, sharp fruity esters and citrus hops, beyond that some nice toasty notes, bready yeast, molasses, licorice, fig, dark fruit and light sweet woody notes. Flavor is full of toffee, and toast up front, then some caramel/burnt sugar come in, then, nice raisiny dark fruit, earthy and citrusy hops, tree fruit, bread pudding and sweet, oily citrus notes to the finish. Creamy to oily feel on entry, chewy and creamy after that until the somewhat dry, ever so slightly astringent finish. Really good stuff, very smooth and inviting for such a full flavored, strong and young Barley Wine, the trade off is that it might not be as complex and interesting as some of its contemporaries. Thats not to say its one dimensional, by any means, and it is quite delicious, it just lacks a little depth, though it makes up for it by just being really tasty.
Tulip pour. Pours reddish and carbonated. Little head that dissipates rapidly. Dry taste. Carbonated mouthfeel. Overrated in my opinion

Pours a nice copper with a substantial frothy head.  Lot of hops on the nose, nice rich caramel malts.  Well balanced between the bitter and sweet.  Very well done barley wine, on the hoppy side of barley wines, but not over the top.
light hoppy malty aroma,orange, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, soft carbonation, nice hoppy finish.
Bottle 0.75l at Gallows Bird, Espoo. Helsinki. Colour is clear dark orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, raisins, hops and malts. Fabulous.

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Murky amber in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of cereal grains, caramel, and light hops. Flavors are of pale malt, bright herbal hops, mild caramel, toast, and booze. Not overly heavy, and super drinkable. Quite surprizing that the hops taste as fresh as they do inspite of the bottle being at least a couple of years old. Quite good overall.

750 ml bottle. Hazy coppery colour, thick off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt, dried fruits, grapefruit and pine. The flavour is sweetish fruity, caramel malty, with a finish of grapefruit, bitter piney hops and a little warming alcohol. Very enjoyable.
Found a bottle in Seattle.  Boozy on the palate and some fruitiness on the taste.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 750 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours clear copper with a small frothy offwhite head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is sweet, slightly fruity and tiny herbal with caramel, grapefruit juice, biscuits, alcohol, pine needles, resinous wood, lemon zest, orange zest and hints of peat. Taste is sweet and bitter with crackers, caramel, biscuits, lots of grapefruit rinds, alcohol, pine needles, resinous wood, toffee and hints of peat and burnt cookies. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny oily bitter, slightly boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with caramel, grapefruit rinds, pine needles, resinous wood and orange peal.

Pours a deep hazy red with a light khaki head. Lots of hops on the nose, mostly piney and floral with a touch of citrus, theres also lots of malt up front with a good bit of fruity sweetness and some caramel. Lots of malty caramel and breadiness up front, dark fruits like cherry and plum in the middle and lots of thick piney hops on the end. Medium bodied and well balanced, one of the better barleywines Ive had.

Slightly hazy brownish / copper with a medium, dense, off-white head. Aroma is dried fruits, cake and some caramel. Flavor is sweet with some toffee/caramel notes, dried fruits, some nuttiness. Full palate, robust, but gentle at the same time, nice sweet and peaty aftertaste.

From a 750 ml bottle, pours a deep golden brown with a foamy head, malty aroma of caramel, biscuit and bready malts, balanced nicely with pine 
& citrus hops. Thick & slightly viscous mouthfeel with warming alcohol, aftertaste is crisp and balanced. Quality brew.

Bottle. Pours clear amber brown with a good lacing  frothy off-white average head. Aroma is booze, cheese, toasted malt, lime, caramel, toffee, ripe fruit, bread, hops and anise. Taste is medium sweet and medium+ bitter. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Finishes bitter and warming.
Botella. Hazy  golden colour. white head. Sweet fruity caramel piney aroma. Good mouthfeel. Swwet caramel fruity toasty piney flavour, good bitterness. Nice.

Bottle. Clear hazelnut brown with a medium sized good lacing off white head. Aroma is honey, over ripe fruits, caramel, toffee, butterscotch, light bread, fruity. Taste is near heavy sweet and light/medium fat with some light roasted bitterness. Medium/full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Full caramel finish with warming alcohol and light booze.

750ml Bottle - Copper with red tinges. Leather, dried fruit, caramel, spice and fruitcake in the aroma. Fruity, sweet, warming and moderately hoppy taste with spicy malt, grapefruit, toffee and fruitcake detected. Full-bodied and indulgent.
Island fruits, toffee, malt, honey and hops. Theres a lot going on in this beer but its balanced nicely.

2010 Vintage in a 22 oz bottle.  pours a perfect amber / honey hue.  Smells of figs, pear, raisins, burbon and hops.  Taste is heavy!  Raisin, bread pudding and brown sugar.  Lingers on the palate with a massive hop profile. even after 3 years of bottle conditioning and mellowing.  Very stong alchol warming on the back end.  Wow!  fantastic!

Not sure what age this one was; it had Alesmith written in blue below the anvil. Anyway, the best barley wine I've ever had. Really clean, flavors are not muddled at all. Big palate but smooths out into a dry finish. This one made a big impression. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle sent by weihenweizen several months back, finally getting to it, pours a very dark amber red with an off white head and a little bit of lacing, aroma is full of caramel mixed in with a little bit of dark fruit, almost some chocolate like notes coming through, wow, the flavor has a nice amount of toffee and caramel on the front end with a really sweet finish, the abv is pretty much hidden through out the drink, warms you up a little bit though, really nice, now that I can find this in Illinois I will probably pick this up to hang on to a little longer.

Pours a dark, nearly opaque honey-amber with flecks of floating vegetable matter and barley malt particles. A huge, fluffy, caramel-colored, orange-hued head forms. In fact, it overflowed my glass and I didnt even pour as aggressively as I normally do. Asymmetrical lacing and clumps of suds stick to the glass. Aromas of toffee, cherry, and sorghum dominate. Citrus and alcohol sensations in the olfactory. It has a thick, smooth mouthfeel. Flavors of ultra sweet brown sugar and sorghum up front. A little citrus tartness on the back of the tongue accentuated by a mild carbonation burn. It has a sugary butterscotch hard candy finish. A good dessert sipper.
Bottle. Dark brune pour with some tan head. Sweet and meatier tones , touch of smoke and toasted flavors. Aroma is a bit more in your face but same character.

On tap at AleSmith brewery. Hazy copper pour. Thick off-white head that lingers and leaves nice lacing. Toasted malt, mild hops, and caramel aroma.
Malt sweetness balanced by bold hops that crescendo towards the finish and linger on. Overall a damn good barley wine.

Pours golden orange with a small off white head. Nose is citrus, English toffee, caramel, peaches and wood. The taste is big sweetness with a medium bitterness that gives it amazing balance. The texture is sticky and a bit astringent. The body is heavy and the finish is long. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at the Blarney Wine tasting on 03/16/2013: Murky reddish-brown color with a medium thick off-white head that diminishes slowly. Patchy lacing on the glass. The aroma consists of caramel, piney hops and malt. Full-bodied with flavors of earthy malt, figs, caramel and resiny hops. The finish is sweet with a caramel malt and dark fruit aftertaste. Shocked that it has taken me so long to try this well-executed Barley Wine.

750ml bottle. Pours a clear reddish amber with light tan head and lacing. Aroma is so, so resinous. Buttery caramel underneath but this is all about the hop presence. Lots of grapefruit and berry character. Maltier on the tongue with more buttery caramel. The hops neutralise most of the sweetness which might be preferable for some but I prefer my barley wines to be sweet. Its nice and balanced but the flavours dont seem particularly complex, but then maybe Ive been spoilt by some great barrel aged examples. Apart from these quibbles this is solid and well-made stuff from AleSmith as usual.

Thick foamy head misty dark rich salmon pour soft carbonation aromas apricot peach pine grain caramel hay dryness toffee brandy the flavours floral peach apricot pine sweet grain caramel cognac hay toffee rich citrus medium strong bitter taste good balance flavours outdo the alcohol finish crisp like tastes on palate rich resiny hop mix liger sharp maltiness sweetness grain smooth alcohol very nice

Copper with a large pale beige head that laces well. Aroma of toasty caramel, dried fruit, spices, peach, a little mango. Just syrupy, lowish carbonation. Sweet with fruit and slightly buttery toffee, floral and spicy hops. Bitterness is firm but pretty much balances the sweetness. Alcohol is obvious, but not egregious. Well balanced but clean to a fault. Film pairing: Invasion of the Body Snatchers. [edit] What charmless rubbish.
UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 Stupendously fruity (some from hops, and some from malt), candy sugar mid-palate, and a very nice, long hoppy, dry finish, silky, smooth body.

Wow. Its hard to pick this apart considering it holds all the qualities of the things I love. Malts sweetness and hop aroma. But it isnt overly "syrupy" or excessively sweet. So right in its balance. Really perfect.

What struck me initially was I thought this tasted similar to the brewdog harcore IPA. It is medium to full bodied, with a hoppy floral aroma and a malty background with honey sweetness. The mouth feel is lovely, very smooth & perfectly carbonated. As it warms is has a whiskey quality to it. Amazing beer.

Bouteille 750ml (2003), courtoisie de Hogtownharry ou Blankboy. De couleur ambrée très foncée et légèrement voilée. Nez fruité (prunes, raisins, pêches, léger de cerises et dagrumes), malté de caramel toffee sucré, léger dalcool liquoreux, de malt rôti de et de houblon résineux aux notes citriques avec des notes de sucre brun, de vanille et de pain. Ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen une texture riche, légèrement crémeuse et sirupeuse. Goût assez fruité (raisins rouges vineux, prunes, léger dagrumes sucrées, notes de pommes, de figues, de pêches et de cerises), avec des notes de vanille lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de caramel toffee sucré légèrement rôti avec des notes de sucre brun et de pain parallèlement à un goût amer de houblon résineux, légèrement citrique et herbeux. Progressivement un goût dalcool moyen réchauffant (notes liquoreuses et vineuses) vient se rajouter et accompagné de notes de sucre brun puis en finale, lamertume de houblon est plus herbeux (notes terreuses). Post-goût long et un peu sec, moyennement amer dalcool, de houblon résineux et herbeux avec un goût fruité (pelures de prunes , notes de zeste dagrumes).

Clear reddish brown, great creamy foam, tons of lacing. Risk molasses and nut aroma. Flavor is surprisingly hoppy after sitting in my fridge for almost a year. Cherry, vanilla, nut as well. Somewhat boozy but not too much. Good, maybe not something i would drink a lot of though.

Bottle.
Pours red brown. Heavy brew, smoot with lots of american hops. A bit like Stone DB but duller and boozier.
Bottle pours a deep, murky, red/brown with a large, fluffy, off white top. Scent is toasty, caramel and fruits. Taste follows scent with a distinct hoppiness added.

Clear amber colour, off-white head. Aroma of malts, hops, apricot, honey and citrus. Bitter flavour, honey, apricots, spices and lingering sweetness. Quite bitter finish, sweet, honey and peach.
(From 75cL bottle @ ZZT VI. Courtesy of joes. Thanks for sharing, sir!)

Bottle. Pours a hazy brown color with a small off white head. This ones got a little bit of everything. Its surprisingly hoppy. It has got notes of orange and toffee. But its still not overly sweet. Heavy buttery notes. Smooth.

Bottle from brewdog.com. Hazy brown color with huge off-white head. Aroma of caramel, figs, honey, dates, grapefruity hops. Taste, sweet malt, honey, floral hops, bee wax, spices. Strong alcoholic finish with hoppy touch. Excellent beer.

Bottle @ Kiss The Kitchen Floor or better known as ZZT VI (2013): kindly shared by Joes:
Medium sized creamy foamy head on top of a hazy amber colored beer.
Aromas of cream, fruit, apricot, peach, cleaner, chalk, grains, sticky and earthy.
Flavours of barleys, wheat, peach, light bitter, bitter malts, creamy. Smooth.
Aftertaste is bitter, malts, bitter fruit and barleys.
Low carbo, medium soft to light spicy mouthfeel, medium to full body and a creamy light oily texture.
Good and balanced.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Zzt bottle. Flaky orange body, tad cloudy. Fantastic aroma with hints of piny hops, warm alcohol and ripe fruit. The beer itself is very drinkable yet still deep and complex, nice bitterness in aftertaste

Sampled from bottle @ ZZT VI. Hazy reddish color, medium sized off-white head that leaves nice lacing. Smell malts, sweetness, caramel. Taste malts, caramel, sticky texture, alcohol, some bitter. Superb beer!
Bottle thx to joes @ ZZT VI. Hazy copper to bordaux red. Smells pine, sweet, hops.. Typical imperial ipa smell. Tastes very sweet, barley, hops, pine. Full body, sticky sweet, soft carbo.

750 ml bottle.
Pours a deep ruby amber colour with a white thick head. Aroma of berries, toasted malts, caramel and some biscuity notes. Flavour of strong caramel malts, berries, biscuit, some bitter chocolate notes and grassy bitterness. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Finishes malty, a bit sticky and bitter. A rather classic US style barley wine.

75 cl bottle @ home, no BBE info
Sweet and malty aroma with lots of caramel, some american hops, fruits and berries. Flavour has harsh malt, caramel, some vanilla, fruits, berries and distant oaky notes. Dry finish with stronger oak aromas. Warming alcohol in throat, otherwise the 11% is very well hidden. Just too American ( = sweet).

75 cl bottle.
Pours slightly hazy amber color with a medium sized head. Aroma of sweet ripe fruits, plums, toffee notes, sugary caramel, mild hops and some resin. Flavor of sweet caramel, ripe fruits, mild lemon, toffee, brown sugar and syrup notes. Sticky sugary sweet palate, lingering fruity finish. A bit too sweet but otherwise a solid american barley wine.
6426

750ml bottle

Pours dark orange with a foamy white head. Aroma of strong and sweet caramely malty notes, syrup, fruits, berries and wood. Taste is strong, sweet and malty with syrup, caramel, toffee, hints of wood and hoppy fruits. Finish is sweetish and smooth with warming malty notes, some bitter hoppy notes as well. Quite well balanced, but perhaps a bit too sweet for my taste.

This would be one of the most cleanest barley wines that I have ever tried - not that I have tried too many.  Subtle intensity in the nose, and good length on the palate, but this beer is almost too clinical that it lacks character.

Bottle from Binnys Bloomington. Pours a deep chestnut brown, red hints, fluffy offwhite head. Nose is herbal and grassy, along with caramel, rich malts and sweetness. Pretty clean overall. English if I had to guess. On tasting, really robust bitterness, caramelization is really nice and clean, not cloying. Moderate sweetness, body could stand to be a bit bigger but a really solid Barley wine overall.

Pours a cloudy Amber brown with thick tan head. Ridiculous lacing and a pancake of foam that lasts. Aromas of roasted cereal, caramel, plenty of earthy hop aromas of pine resin and grass cuttings. Taste is rich and sweet bready malts that blend into a nuance of caramel, citrus, more bread, and a tinge of alcohol warmth. Finish starts sweet but rather dry in the overall palate. AleSmith has a dominant beer in class here.

75cl bottle from Cotteridge Wines (all to my gutsy self!)..This poured a dirty amber unclear colour although it had been stood for weeks.Just a wisp of froth for a head.Nose consisted of caramel,malt,hop.alcohol and some spice.The spice and alcohol notes developed as the beer warmed a little.On the taste a mix of dark fruit,caramel and malt slightly jumbled together.Halfway down the bottle as my palate put things into order and the beer had warmed a bit from chilled the taste became even better.Glad i had the whole bottle of this one as it has some complexity and depth as well as a nice alcohol taste.Nice tasting beer to sip away at while sitting in front of the fire lookiong at the snow outside.
Bottle at bar. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with malts, nuts, earthy aroma, hops, citrus, caramel and coffee. Great balance between hops and malts. Exquisite barley wine.

A malt/caramel taste, you dont feel any heat. It very well crafted, nothing different or particularly special but so well rounded and balanced. I loved it! This is now a benchmark for great barley wines.
(Bottle 23/01-2013) Large beige head, clear amber color, hoppy aroma, slightly alcohol taste, sweet malty taste, slightly bitter.
Bottled. Malty, caramel and phenolic aromas. Pours hazy amber, with average off-white head. Medium to full body, average carbonation. Taste is malty, some spicy, smooth and enjoyable. Nice one.

Klar, koppar färgad med fast ljus brunt skum. Doft: Ananas, trä, apelsin, vanilj, lätt rostat mörktbröd, fikon, malt. Smak: Mörk choklad, lakrits, ananas, bran flakes, fikon, rostad malt, druv skal och kärnor, vanilj, frukter i allmänhet. Alkohol halten märks endast lätt på doften.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2013 Big time honey and grapefruit scents. Great appearance with a nice lasting and lacing head. Taste is a bit of caramel with a lot of hops and a perfect clean finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

January 20, 2013 - bottle shared by Brandon.  Brown pour with nice head that lasted and nice lacing.  Aroma was honey, caramel, dark fruit, spice and alcohol.  Taste was caramel and honey sweetness to start and the dark fruit, alcohol and bitterness come out in the finish.  Smooth and medium to full thickness.  Oh yeah this was solid, really need to try the BA version.

Clear red body with a medium white head. Malty aroma with spices, caramel, strawberry and a herbal bitter finish. Full body with little carbonation. Bittersweet flavour, starting sweet malty with mango, spices, raisins, and a strong herbal bitter undertone. Great.

Mahogany pour, thin offwhite head and lacing. Lots of aroma: dark surypu bread, dark roasted butterscotch, alcohol, dark dried fruits. Velvety feel, really soft and round, slick, medium body, soft and low carbonation, more fruits than in aroma, malty caramel finish is long, sitcky sweet with bitterness in background and prominent warm alcohol. After a cold, cold  winter day I would love  to have this by fireplace. One to warm you slowly.

Pours dark ruby with a huge head that dissipates to lots of lacing. Aroma is citrusy hops, caramel malt and alcohol. Taste opens on malt before moving to hops, finishing with vanilla and oak notes and a strong alcohol punch. Luxurious mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille de 750 ml. Arômes de houblons américains, surtout résineux et fruités, belle dose de malt caramélisé et grillé. Robe rubis et plutôt claire, effervescence moyenne et légère dentelle beige. En bouche, des malts caramélisés et grillés supportent bien une belle dose de houblons résineux. Texture soyeuse et plutôt ronde. Lalcool demeure bien dissimulé pour une bière aussi forte. Longue finale sucrée et moyennement amère. Un barley wine américain classique, mais il sagit dun style que japprécie de moins en moins.

pours a nice ruby red with a substantial thick head.  looks nice. hops dominate the nose - resiny, floral, and sweet overtones. really nice and smooth taste; Sweet up front balanced by the strong floral hops.  Grassy after taste. Good stuff, would love to try some that has relaxed for a year or so.

A reddish brown beer with a dense and beige head. Aroma of toffee, some caramell, lots of hops that are mix of citrusfruits, pine and wood. The great balance of sweet toffeeish malts and lots of piney hops in the taste. Also, some caramell, pine, wood and some herbs in the aftertaste. Full bodied, smooth and nice to drink. Balanced, US-style Barley wine with lots of hops, powerfull, but also very easy and enjoyable.

Mohogany pour with a light brown head. Aroma is citrus hops. Taste is sweet, nice malt backbone. Little burnt sugar, citrus, dry finish. Alcohol is noticable during the drink and more so since I drank the bottle myself.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2014 bottle.  2012?  hazy red/copper with a small, frothy beige head.  fresh green citrusy hops and alcohol in aroma.  big piney flavors dominate this one with tons of warmth in the end.  caramel malts with hints of cinnamon-like spice and fruity esters.  piney hops almost provide a distinct coolness in the finish.  

2013?  clear reddish copper with a small cream colored head.  big hoppy nose.  flavor has a strong buttered toast flavor with citrusy hops.  more malty than i remember.

Murky caramel with big, creamy, beige head / Rich, sweet, winey nose of fresh caramel, cut pine, and citrus / Full body, chewy and sweet, big malts amply balanced by big, biting hops, with fine bitterness on the long finish / Flavors of fresh caramel, cut pine, orange, grapefruit, raisin, date, licorice, and honey / Great stuff.

Aroma: Smelling of brown bread, pine resin and dry grass.Appearance: A foggy amber colored beer. A low off-white head with small lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting of sweet toffee, brown bread, dried fruits, apricots, pine resin and grape-fruit peel.Palate: Low carbonation, a soft, sticky and oily texture. A big body with a somewhat dry finish.Overall: A heavy, full and nice sipping brew.Note: Bottle 650 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2012-12-29.

Barley wine and a real good barley wine, but is this a really good beer. I like it verymuch but is it a beer??? I surrender because  I like it !

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2014 750 bottle that has been sitting for 2 months, maybe slightly longer. Pours a beautiful deep red-orange, clear, with big creamy head that has an orange/beige hue. Smells like serious pine and toffee. Was surprised at the hop presence in the aroma here. Nice toffee flavor, with a hit of hop on the tongue. Bit of grapefruit and slight booze, but hides the abv awfully well. This is a bit too easy to drink, and definitely the most balanced of the style that I have ever encountered. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Heller, herb trockener Antrunk. Würzig werdend, Erdnussnoten. Würzig, geringe Alkoholnoten, vollmundig. Herb malzig, brotig. Langer Nachhall. Sehr gut! 11/12/12/9/12/12
Bomber. Starts off with grapefruit and pine. Thick malty background with dark fruit flavors. Finishes with some nice bitterness and light alcohol. Tasty.

Ar: fruity hops, grapefruit, resin, big malt prescence, jam, toffe, caramel, dried prunes, raisins, alcohol.
Ap: amber/copper colour, medium beige head, lacing.
F: big bite, lots of hops, grapefruit, resin, thick malt backbone, caramel, toffee, raisins, honey, warming finish, long lingering bitterness. 
M: medium carbonation and mouthfeel.
On tap in the Alesmith tasting room, copper color, bitter citrus hops on the nose. Malt body to stand up to the hops. An easier drinking barleywine than I expected.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2013 Murky caramel with big, creamy, beige head / Rich, sweet, winey nose of fresh caramel, dark fruit, cut pine, citrus / Full body, chewy and sweet, big malts amply balanced by big, biting hops, with fine bitterness on the ever so slightly hot finish / Flavors of fresh caramel, cut pine, orange, grapefruit, raisin, date, licorice, and honey / Great stuff.

Bottle @ BrewDog Glasgow. Orange amber colour, reasonable head. Sweet fruity hoppy  resin aroma. Strong sickly sweet hoppy grain flavour. Lingering strong alcohol sweet hoppy aftertaste. Too strong for me.

750 ml bottle served in a Westbrook tulip. Thanks to BA kevanb for the bottle in a trade long, long ago.

A: Pours a dark ruby color with a fluffy and thick light khaki head forming on the pour. It recedes slowly to a thick ring and sticky sheets of lace are left behind.

S: Dark fruits with some brown sugar, biscuit and a little caramel malt. Some mild sweetness as well.

T: Heavier on the malts. Some biscuit and caramel malt flavors with some light dark fruit. A little raisin and slightly nutty as well. A touch of dried grass from some residual hops as well.

M: Medium bodied with a medium low carbonation level. Nice drinkability as well.

O: This was a solid drink. Not extremely complex as the malt dominated, but it was nicely put together.

Serving type: bottle

Serving: 2009 bottle from Hi-Time Wine Cellars.  It pours a hazy copper color with a medium, light tan head.  The nose reminds me of King Syrup.  Lots of toffee and caramel.  Light stone fruit as well.  The flavor blows your mind with dried fruit, toffee, slight oxidized notes, and a little bit of alcohol.  The alcohol dries things out nicely on the back end, but all the malt still keeps things a little chewy.  The flavor shifts to raisin and prune notes as the beer warms.  Great lasting flavor.  I need to get more of this.

Tap. Pours clear copper amber with a small tan head, nice lacing. Aroma is very hoppy with strong grapefruit and pine notes backed by some caramel. Flavor is about the same, lightly sweet, light-plus bitter and a warming finish. Very much a hop-forward beer. Medium body.

Nice mouthfeel and hops good on the nose and smooth in taste. Very good after taste. A little hot but overall nice malty roundness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy mahogany pour with fluffy tan-yellow head.  Sticky caramel malt and thick skunky pine.  Flavor is caramel, toasted and faint roasted malt with an even skunky pine bitterness.  Mix of both elements in the finish.  Somewhat sticky, but very smooth.  Mouthfeel thinner than expected.
Bottle. Clear amber, tanned head. Aroma of red wine, port, alcohol and slight hop appearance. Sweet, light alcoholic taste, full malted body. Awesome, well balanced brew. Very nice!
UPDATED: NOV 24, 2012 Smell of nuts and cocoa. Red brown cloudy colour, very high beige head. Aroma of alcohol, nuts, dadles. Oily texture. Flat carbon.

Bottled:Pours deep amber with a lacing head. Hops, resin, pine, biscuits, orange peels, shampoo and alcohol on the nose. Thick and oily mouthfeel. Flavour is hops, licorice, oranges, grapefruit and alcohol. Long bitterness.
From bottle. Great ruby appearance almost no head. Present malty aroma with slight hop scent. Great sweet flavor with hop taste but little bitterness. Maybe the best example of the style Ive had.

750 ml brown bottle. Been wanting to try this since I joined this site, thanks BlackIPA. Poured in a tulip glass. Its a reddish-orange color with a large head. The aroma has caramel, raisins, citrus and fruity hop undertones. The taste has oranges, and more caramel. Slightly sweet in the finish with just the right amount of bitterness to counter. This beer is insanely drinkable for its alcohol percentage and style.
Bottled 75cl. Copper appearance. Resinous hops, caramel, raisins, boletus and niaouli honey showing up in the nose. Full bodied. Strong bitterness. Low carbonation. Very true to the style.

Cant find the exp. date, but fairly new edition i assume.
Hazy rustic brown toxic stuff. Light brown head and plenty of it. Smell of hops, syrup, alcohol, barley, fudge and much more. Again really hoppy taste, but surprisingly burned. Got some nice port wine going on. Perhaps some kind of whiskey too? Very american, but not as sweet as i could have suspected from the smell. The booze is present, but in a mature way. Very thick and round, but well balanced with the fairly fresh hops.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2013 Bottle purchased @Brewdog then shared with friends, actually reminds me of an oaked double IPA the hops are really pushed forward very fruity, the alcohol is non existent no burn at all, slight tones of sweet brandy and a hint of butterscotch and orange.
Bottle. Pours deep amber with a beige head. Toffee, earthy hops, light sweetness, light flowery notes, and grainy pale malts. Good stuff.
Bottle shared by Blipp. Pours brown with tan head. Nose/taste of darker fruit, caramel, honey comb, toasted malt, resin and toffee. Medium body. Well balanced complexity.

400th reviewed beer. Kanpai! (Japanese for cheers!) Big, fat hops greet the nose with a subtle caramel and oat malt behind it. Brownish tan appearance with a thick foam and beautiful lacing against the glass. Remarkably smooth texture with intensely complex flavors of oats, dough, butter, and earthy hops upfront falling into a genius melted caramel, anise, sage and massive alcohol filled finish. Overall, Old Numbskull is truly a magnificent undertaking boasting immense flavors and stupendous balance. Id give this an A+ rating.

12.99 bottle from cleveland ohio beer shop. Aged for around 6 months. Pours a medium amber with more of the red hues producing a light flakey/foamy head. Aromas of mellowed caramel, mellowed aged fruity/herbal/spicey hops, and hints of whiskey. Flavors are a mix of caramel and fruity/herbal hops upfront then into an alcoholic stage which comes medium strong through the nose. Theres just a light touch of honey there to. Medium sweet, highly bitter leaving a bitter finish and stain on the palate. Well rounded hop/malt balance yet the alcohol can make it a less pleasent experience. The bottle detail is great and I wonder if they will ever add a rating catagory for the bottle itself, as I would give this one a top rating.

Bottle.
Ruby with a beige head.
Aroma: malty, fruity, soapy, citrus, pine.
Taste: malty, fruity, earthy, berries, floral, toffee, dried tropical fruits, citrus, a greater hoppiness appears after a while, medium bitter.
Quite full-bodied.

750 ml bottle 2011 vintage.  Pours a dark amber with large creamy beige head that lasts.  Smell is creamy dark fruits, caramel, vanilla sweetness, sugary figs.  Taste is big fig/raisin/dark fruits with rich caramel and sweetness but not cloying. Also, some cocoa and tobacco notes.   The booze is well hidden.  In fact this is remarkable smooth.  Fantastic.

Bottle at home from Brewdog online.
Dark amber with fluffy offwhite head. Amazing sticky orange marmalade and underlying gingersnap biscuits. Quite sweet, light bodied, oranges, crystal malt, orange pith, balanced with malt bitterness. Touch of mango, long dry orange juice  fairly pithy finish.  Lovely.

Medium beige head. Hazy red brown body. Perfumy grainy caramel and raisins aroma with alcoholic spice and toffee notes. Sweet-dry earthy roasty caramel taste with perfumy fruity alcohol notes. Full-bodied. Faintly hot mouthfeel. Dryish roasty chocolate and toffee aftertaste with soy sauce and vanilla fudge notes. Great! Subtle, harmonic and full of flavour. Slightly artificial, sadly. (0.65l bottle shared with MR, Schouskjelleren, Oslo.)

Pours a cloudy toffee color with a wispy off white head. Strong hop aromas in the nose, along with plenty of sweet malts.  Taste is akin to a very hoppy IPA yet with an enormous malt backbone. Massive. This seems like a pretty fresh bottle... So hop forward that it is almost a DIPA. I can see this one aging well and transforming into an super malty yet mellow Barleywine. No alcohol detected. Man, this is good shit. Easy to pound a 750ml in under 5 minutes.
On draft at alesmith. Pours a hazy brown with a creamy off white head. Spicy toffee aroma. Vegetal notes. Bitter slightly metallic finish.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Sweet malty smell with some hops, grapefruit. Similar taste. Very nice to lean back and sip at.

Bottle 750ml @ My 30th birthday tasting
Pours cloudy amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, dried fruits and alcohol. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light to medium bitter with a long sweet fruity and caramel finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Clear reddish amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. 300912
Bottle. Clear dark amber with medium tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel, dark fruits, toffee, hop and oak. Flavour is malt, caramel, toffee, medium sweet, oak, hop, quite bitter with notes of alcohol.
Bottle. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is dark amber. Aroma and taste are fruits, caramel, syrup, candy sugar notes, malt and hops. Nice and sweet.

Bottle shared with BenH (Cheers!) @ BrewDog Edinburgh 280912
Reddish orange dark amber, clear, off white head 
Aroma - Caramel malts, some hop resins, soft grassy hop, very malty, bit of toffee, orange, dried cake fruits, fairly complex, alcohol not as noticeable as in the taste
Taste - as aroma, very malty, nice fruity malts, not that complex, more booze coming though, its too boozy
Palate - soft carb, full body, oily texture. Finish - caramel fruity malts, smooth syrupy, nice dark fruits, bit of sherry, too much hot alcohol though
Overall - Too much alcohol in this for me, its wasnt that hidden in the taste.

Bottle shared with stravale, cheers. Pours a nice glowing brown with off white head. Aroma has something different everytime I go to it, dried fruits, prunes and dates, biscuit and cake mix, toffee and caramel.
